27 ¶ Ici poez o&ydot;er coment seint Seint
Thomas de Kaunterbures nasqui. e de quev manere gent de pere e de Mere.

Of seint Seint
Thomas of Caunterburi &punctelev; alhou he was biȝite
Of
londone Londone is fader was &punctelev; A bo&rrot;de&ydot;s[r. bo&rrot;ge&ydot;s] hende and fre

Ase A sclaue fo&rrot;th ilad &punctelev; and idon In in p&rrot;isone

And iwu&slong;t wel sikerliche &punctelev; þat he ne scholde awei go

To ȝeres and an half &punctelev; In bendes swiþe &slong;trongue

And oftesiþes þe Amiral &punctelev; dude fo&rrot; Gilebardes loue

Þat it were fo&rrot; g&ydot;le &punctelev; þat heo with him speke
Ȝeot it bifeol In in a dai &punctelev; þat heo saiȝ þo heo miȝte

Of
engelonde Engelonde ich am and cri&slong;tine Man man &punctelev; þei ich beo nouþe here
Mi name is Gilbert beket &punctelev; of Londene þe cite
gladliche icholde þane deth afongue &punctelev; fo&rrot; is loue þat[MS. þad.] bouȝte me
And fo&rrot;to saui mi cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; and mine trewe bileue also
Þis womman to Gilbert wel sone &punctelev; þeos wo&rrot;des heo seide to

And þou anon afturward &punctelev; treweliche weddi me
Gilbert was ful so&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; of þis wommane sawe
La&slong;te heo wolde biMeldi him &punctelev; ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ he were aslawe

So þat he and is felawes &punctelev; gonne heom onder&slong;tonde
Þat heo wolden þet p&rrot;ison b&rrot;eke &punctelev; and Aweiward gon
So&rrot;e heo weren alle aferd &punctelev; fo&rrot; traison of þat womman
Þat p&rrot;ison heo b&rrot;eken &punctelev; riȝt þulke daie at eue
Fo&rrot;th heo wenden alle awei &punctelev; þare nolde non bileue

hov heo miȝte be&slong;t on take &punctelev; and ȝwat heo miȝte do

Albi n&ydot;ȝte heo wende awei &punctelev; men nu&slong;ten ȝware heo bicam
Ne heo ne couþe nanne wei &punctelev; bote god God was hire lodesman
Þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace heo was ilad &punctelev; with men þat onder&slong;toden hire langage
So þat heo cam to þe se &punctelev; and redi fond hire passage
Þane wei heo Axede In in hire langage &punctelev; Into engelonde Engelonde

heo ne couþe noþing conteini hire &punctelev; ne speken noþemo

londone Londone fo&rrot;to go
Mid pilegrimes and þo&rrot;u grace of god God &punctelev; to londone Londone heo cam
And þo heo was þudere icome &punctelev; þare ne knev heo no man
Ne heo ne couþe speke ne hire biseo &punctelev; bote ase a be&slong;t þat a&slong;tra&ydot;ed were
Þarefo&rrot;e on hire gapede alda&ydot; &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe muche fol[c] þere

ha&slong;teliche he to&rrot;nede In in aȝen &punctelev; to is louerd anon
And seide þe Amirales douȝter was &punctelev; In þe &slong;trete þareoute

he het is knaue loki sothþeliche &punctelev; ȝif þat heo it were
And bad hire leden to ane guode w&ydot;ues house &punctelev; and a&slong;tunte with hire þere

Also t&ydot;me ase þis knaue &punctelev; to þis Ma&ydot;de cam

Þo hire &slong;tat was aȝein icome &punctelev; þe knaue hire op nam
And heo wel gladliche with him eode &punctelev; to þulke guode womman
And heo hire onderfeng swiþe faire &punctelev; fo&rrot; gilberdes Gilberdes loue
heo makede hire wel anA&ydot;se &punctelev; and was hire sw&ydot;þe welcome
Gilbert him biþouȝte &punctelev; anon so he hadde iete

poules Poules &punctelev; of him to habbe red anon
Alȝwat him were of þat Maide &punctelev; is be&slong;te fo&rrot;to don
Þane bischop of londone Londone &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe he fond þere
And f&ydot;ue oþur bischopes &punctelev; with him þare were
So þat he fond þare six bischopes &punctelev; þe be&slong;te of Engelonde

And hou he and is felawes &punctelev; bitwene hem alle bispeke

la&slong;te heo weren alle fo&rrot; hire &punctelev; to &slong;tronge deþe idon

Þat hit was al þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; þat heo was so fer icome

Fo&rrot; heo ne couþe language non &punctelev; with men fo&rrot;to speke

Þat schal holie churche holde to riȝte &punctelev; and serui godes Godes sone
Fo&rrot; we it mowen wel iwite &punctelev; and we wollen us onder&slong;tonde
Þat heo is into þis londe icome &punctelev; it is godes Godes sonde

seint Seint
poules Poules churche þat heo scholde &punctelev; Icri&slong;tned beo riȝt þare
Þo þe bapti&slong;terie was alredi &punctelev; to hire baptizingue
Þe bischopes beden þat Men scholden &punctelev; þe womman bifo&rrot;e heom b&rrot;inge

heo was inemd Alisaund&rrot;e &punctelev; as ich me onder&slong;tonde

thomas Thomas

he ne lai non mo&rrot;e bi hire &punctelev; þane he dude bifo&rrot;e

Þat him þoute deiȝe he scholde &punctelev; bote he wende aȝenward sone
Ake he biþouȝte him of is wiues &slong;tat &punctelev; ȝwat were of hire to done

And gret deol to hire nime &punctelev; fo&rrot; langage ne couþe heo non
Þat ani Man man couþe onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; þat heo speke to

So þat gilbert Gilbert was in grete þouȝte &punctelev; and bigan to sike so&rrot;e
la&slong;te is wif gret harm habbe scholde &punctelev; ȝwane he iwend weo&rrot;e
Þarefo&rrot;e gilbert Gilbert mournede muche &punctelev; and siȝte &slong;tille and softe
la&slong;te is wif furfare scholde &punctelev; he biþouȝte him ofte

Ȝif him mislikede aniþing &punctelev; þat grefde him in þouȝte
So &slong;treitliche heo fra&ydot;nede him &punctelev; þat he ne miȝte no leng fo&rrot;sake
he tolde hire hov gret wille he hadde &punctelev; þene wei aȝein to take
Fo&rrot;to trauaili is bodi mo&rrot;e &punctelev; ase euerech man wel ouȝte
Al fo&rrot;to honouri Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat him so deo&rrot;e abouȝte
Þo heo saiȝ gilbertus Gilbertus wille &punctelev; þat it was so guod
heo nolde noþing aȝen him beo &punctelev; fo&rrot;to chaungi is mod
Ake heo ȝaf him conseil þane wei to gon &punctelev; þat he hadde In in þouȝte
And fo&rrot;to queme Iesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat him deo&rrot;e bouȝte
Þare was isene þat heo was treowe &punctelev; and of &slong;tudefa&slong;t mod

Fo&rrot;to serui is creatour &punctelev; þareaȝein heo nolde beo nouȝt

Saue[MS. sone] heo bisouȝte gilbert Gilbert &punctelev; þat he one bone hire ȝeue
Þat heo mo&slong;te is knaue with hire habbe &punctelev; þat hire langage couþe

And þare he bilefde þo &punctelev; fulle furthþehalf ȝer

Into is owene londe &punctelev; alongued he was so&rrot;e
Ȝif þat he was þare ouȝt iknowe &punctelev; Ine can ou tellen non ende
bote ase þe bok us tellez &punctelev; hamward he gan þo wende
And þo he to londene Londene [MS. londene] cam &punctelev; Ichot wel þare he founde

thomas Thomas
Thomas is ȝonge sone &punctelev; boþe hole and sounde
Welle muche was þe Ioie ioie &punctelev; þat he makede with is sone
And also he dude with is wif &punctelev; þo he was hom Icome
And is wif gret Ioie ioie made &punctelev; with hire housebonde

Þat child heo setten to lo&rrot;e &punctelev; are it were seue ȝer eld
Ich wot it leo&rrot;nede swiþe wel &punctelev; and wax swiþe quointe and beld

Þat þe bischop of londone Londone &punctelev; wilnede is seruise

Thomas Erceeueske de Kaunterbur&ydot;.
ENgelond wel glad þov beo &punctelev; fo&rrot; þou miȝt wel eþe
And also holi churche &punctelev; fo&rrot; one Mannes deþe
Þe erchebischop seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; þat[al. þat ou] wel deo&rrot;e bouȝte
With is blod and with is b&rrot;a&ydot;n &punctelev; þat þe scharpe swerd souȝte

At
londone Londone he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; of guode Men inouȝ
Fo&rrot; of londone Londone is fader was &punctelev; a wel guod emne Man man
Þis child was ȝong to schole iset &punctelev; And swiþe wel he bigan
His Moder moder him wolde al da&ydot; rede &punctelev; and wel ofte on him crie
Cha&slong;te lijf and clene fo&rrot;to lede &punctelev; and fo&rrot;sake lecherie
And louien bifo&rrot;e al oþur þing &punctelev; god and seinte Seinte
Marie
And serui hem and holi churche &punctelev; and bileuen alle folie
Þis child þei it were ȝong &punctelev; swiþe wel þis under&slong;tod
Fo&rrot; seli child is sone ilered &punctelev; þare he þenchez to beon guod
Þo þis child was bet in elde &punctelev; and of to and twenti ȝer
his moder wende out of þis liue &punctelev; þat so muchel him louede her
Þis child wolde lengo&rrot;e gon to scole &punctelev; ake is fader him nolde finde
Fo&rrot; þat child þat is modur fo&rrot;leo&slong;t &punctelev; is help is muche bihinde
Þis child þo&rrot;uȝ is fader he&slong;te &punctelev; ase man þat oþur red not
Seruede A bo&rrot;ge&ydot;s of þe toun &punctelev; and his acountes wrot
So longe þat he cam to court &punctelev; and was in guod offiz
With þe erchebischop of Kaunterburi &punctelev; sire tebaud guod and wis
He seruede him so hendeliche &punctelev; þat In in a lu&ydot;tel &slong;tounde
he makede him his conseiller &punctelev; so &slong;tudefa&slong;t he him founde
his ercedekne he makede him sethþe &punctelev; and dude al bi is rede
Sw&ydot;þe wel bigan þis Ercedekne &punctelev; holi churche bilede
And &slong;tifliche heold op hire riȝte &punctelev; þat alle Men iseie

Thomas &punctelev; ȝif it is þi wille

Þe clerkus þat beoth Io&rrot;de&ydot;nede &punctelev; þov wo&slong;t wel heo berez a signe
Þat heo beoth l&ydot;mes of holi churche &punctelev; þat so noble is and digne
Ȝif heo weren with þulke signe &punctelev; to vile deþe ido
Aviled were alholi churche &punctelev; and foule ischend also
And ȝif heo beoth fo&rrot;me&slong;t ono&rrot;deined &punctelev; and fo&rrot; þulke sulue dede
Sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ dom to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; it nere nouȝt wel to rede
Fo&rrot; it nas neuere lawe ne riȝt &punctelev; double dom to take
Fo&rrot; o trespas ase ȝe wel wuteth &punctelev; and sunne it were to make
And vnwu&ydot;rþere þane a lewed Man man &punctelev; holi churche were so
A lewed Man man fo&rrot; o trespas &punctelev; bote o Iuggement nis ido
Þarefo&rrot;e þine grace we biddeth þe &punctelev; ȝif it is þi wille
Þat þov ne arere none newe lawe &punctelev; holi churche to spille
Fo&rrot; we biddez niȝt ant da&ydot; &punctelev; ase riȝt is fo&rrot;to do
Þat god God holde þe þine riȝte &punctelev; and þine reavme also
[Rex.]¶ beav sire quath þe king þo &punctelev; þov sei&slong;t wel inovȝ
Ich hadde lothz bi mi concience &punctelev; don holi churche wovȝ
Fo&rrot; lawes þere beoth and co&slong;tomes &punctelev; þat habbethz euere beon iholde
Of bischopus þo&rrot;uȝ al Engelond &punctelev; ase ovre Aunceteres us tolde
And bi þe kingus da&ydot;e henries Henries &punctelev; þat ovre grauntsire was
Iconfermede weren and iholde &punctelev; And no man þareaȝen nas
Woltþu þulke lawes holde &punctelev; do me to witene sone"
We schullen do seint Seint
Thomas seide &punctelev; al þat is to done[Thomas.]
Alle þe lawes and þe co&slong;tomes &punctelev; we schullen holde bi o&rrot;e miȝte
Þat beothz to holde and habbeth ibeo &punctelev; siresauue oure riȝte
[Rex.]Sauue ouwer riȝte quath þe king &punctelev; bev sire ȝwi sei&slong;tþou so
bi þulke wo&rrot;de In in e scholde noþing &punctelev; aȝen þine wille do
Þat þov nolde&slong;t segge þat it were &punctelev; aȝen holi churche riȝte
And so þou miȝte&slong;t b&rrot;inge al þat lond &punctelev; In contek and In in fiȝte
Ȝe moten holde þe lawes &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe ich onder&slong;tonde
Þat wo&rrot;d me þinchez venimous &punctelev; to þe pa&ydot;s of þe londe
[Thomas.]Sire quath þis holi man &punctelev; ne meue ȝe ov riȝt nouȝt
Wel þov wo&slong;t þat ech of us &punctelev; are we weren hereto ib&rrot;ouȝt
Trewenesse we þe swo&rrot;en ase riȝt was &punctelev; and eo&rrot;þelich honour also
Sauue o&rrot;e o&rrot;d&rrot;e and o&rrot;e riȝte &punctelev; bote þat was out ido
hou scholde we sire nouþe oþur do &punctelev; ȝe ne Auȝten it us nouȝt beode
Fo&rrot; godes Godes loue hold us to riȝte &punctelev; fo&rrot; nouþe we habbez neode
[Rex.]¶ "Ich iseo nouþe thomas Thomas quath þe king &punctelev; ȝwareto þou wult d&rrot;awe
Þov art Icome to late &punctelev; to binimen us ovre lawe
Þov wolde&slong;t makien me mo&rrot;e wrechche &punctelev; þane euere ani k&ydot;ng was
Þareto þov art icome to late &punctelev; þou ca&slong;t aumbes as
þe king [aros] in wrathþe anon &punctelev; and let heom sitte echone
Into is chaumb&rrot;e he wende &punctelev; and ne grette heom neuer one
Fram londone Londone he wende sone &punctelev; In wrathþe ase þei it were
he ne seide no man of is þouȝt &punctelev; ake bilefde heom alle þere
Þe bischopus þouȝten þo echone &punctelev; þat he was wroth inouȝ
Þare weren fewe bote seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; þat toward him ne d&rrot;ouȝ
¶ On seint Seint
Thomas heo criden fa&slong;te &punctelev; is þouȝt fo&rrot;te wende
Oþuer he wolde al þat lond &punctelev; fo&rrot; þulke one wo&rrot;de schende
kniȝtes and oþure ofte comen &punctelev; þat with þe kinge were
And beden seint Seint
Thomas ententifliche &punctelev; þat he þat wo&rrot;d fo&rrot;bere
And þat it were him gret folie &punctelev; þe kinge In in wrathþe b&rrot;inge
And also de&slong;tourbi al þat lond &punctelev; fo&rrot; so lu&ydot;tel þingue
Seint thomas Thomas &slong;tod longe in þouȝte. &punctelev; leoue b&rrot;eþren he seide
Aȝen þe k&ydot;ngus honur Ine schal &punctelev; neuere don no dede
Ake euerech wo&rrot;d ichulle bileue &punctelev; þat aȝen is honur is
Þo weren þis oþure glade inouȝ &punctelev; þo heo iheo&rrot;den þis
And radden him wende to þe kinge &punctelev; is wrathþe fo&rrot;to &slong;tille
Lef me were quath seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; with riȝte to don is wille
He wende to þe kinge to Oxenfo&rrot;d &punctelev; and with him þare he fond
grete Eo&rrot;les and barones also &punctelev; þe hexte of al þe lond
Þe king welcomede seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; ake he ne made him nouȝt fair chere
bischopes and Eo&rrot;les he let cleopien &punctelev; alle þat þere were
[Rex.]¶ "Bev sire he seide "ich am king &punctelev; with riȝte of þis londe
Cu&slong;tomes here weren bifo&rrot;e &punctelev; Ivsed ich onder&slong;tonde
And so muche wrechche nam ich nouȝt &punctelev; þat ich nelle þe lawes holde
Þat ovre Aunce&slong;tres heolden ȝw&ydot;le &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e conseil us tolde
Þarefo&rrot;e ichulle þat þulke lawes &punctelev; iconfermede beoth echon
Of mine eo&rrot;les and mine barones also &punctelev; heo ne withseggez non
Þarefo&rrot;e ich hote ov euerechone &punctelev; þat ȝe beon þat ilke dai
At mi maner at Clarindone &punctelev; withouten ani delai
Fo&rrot;to confermi þis lawes. &punctelev; ope pe&ydot;ne þat i schal ou sette
Ich hote þat ȝe beon þare echone &punctelev; þat non oþur ne lette
So departede þe court þo &punctelev; and euerech to is In in d&rrot;ouȝ
And euere was seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; In care and so&rrot;uwe inouȝ
[Clarendon.]¶ þis bischopes and þe baronie &punctelev; alle comen to þe daiȝe
to
clarindone Clarindone
In in
wilteschire Wiltshire &punctelev; þe kingue fo&rrot;to pa&ydot;e
Þo heo comen to þe parlement &punctelev; þe king axede heom anon
Ȝweþur heo wolden holde þe lawes &punctelev; ase heo&rrot;e Aunce&slong;tres heolden echon
[Thomas.]¶ "Sire sire quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ȝif it þi wille is
Ech man mot speke fo&rrot; himselue &punctelev; and ich fo&rrot; me iwis
Fo&rrot; mi &slong;tat and fo&rrot; holi churche &punctelev; Ich answerie þarto
Þat alle þe olde guode lawes &punctelev; And þat ȝeot beoth also
graunti ichulle fo&rrot; holi churche &punctelev; fo&rrot;to habben þin o&rrot;e
Sauue o&rrot;e riȝtes and o&rrot;e o&rrot;d&rrot;e. &punctelev; þou ne miȝt axi nonmo&rrot;e
¶ Þe king was wodwroth fo&rrot; þat wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat him gan þo mislike
Seint Thomas wep In in is heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and so&rrot;e bigan to sike
Alto blodi was þat wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; and deo&rrot;e it was abouȝt
Þarefo&rrot;e was seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; to &slong;tronge deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; and of No&rrot;thwiche also
Wepinde knevleden to seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; þat he scholde anoþur do
And habbe revþe of alholi churche &punctelev; and of heom echone
Þat we ne beon alle to grounde ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; fo&rrot; þulke wo&rrot;de one
heiȝe Men þat with þe kingue weren &punctelev; mani on als[o] wende
And knevleden to seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; þat wo&rrot;d fo&rrot;to amende
¶ "Louerd&ydot;ngues quath seint Seint
Thomas &punctelev; ich am ȝet a ȝong man
And lu&ydot;te ȝwule habbe bischop ibeo &punctelev; and þaron lu&ydot;tel ich can
Þarefo&rrot;e of ower olde lawes &punctelev; transcrit ȝe me take
And þareoppe ichchulle conseillen me &punctelev; ȝwuche beon to fo&rrot;sake
þe king him let a traunscrit take &punctelev; of þis cu&slong;tomes echon
Seint Thomas grauntede some of heom &punctelev; and withseide mani on
[Prima lex.]¶ Þe lawes þat ichulle nouþe telle &punctelev; he grauntede wel fawe
Ȝif a bondeman hath ane sone &punctelev; þat to clergie beo id&rrot;awe
He[MS. Ne] schal nouȝt withoute is louerdes leue &punctelev; noȝwere icrouned beo
Fo&rrot; þev Man man ne mai nouȝt beon imaket &punctelev; aȝen is louerdes wille freo.
[Alia lex.]¶ An oþur lawe he grauntede also &punctelev; þat ȝe mowen nouþe iseo
Ȝif ani man of holi churche &punctelev; halt aniþing of la&ydot;fe
person p&rrot;eo&slong;t oþur ȝwatso he beo &punctelev; he schal don þerefo&rrot;e
Þe seruise þat to þe kinge bifallez &punctelev; þat is riȝte nere fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
And In in plaidingue &slong;tonde in eche place &punctelev; and In in iuggement also
bote ȝware ani Man man schal beon bileomed &punctelev; oþur to deþe ido.
[Tertia lex.]¶ He grauntede also ȝif ani Man man &punctelev; þe kingues tra&ydot;tur were
And ani man is chateus &punctelev; to holi churche bere
Þat holi churche ne scholde nouȝt &punctelev; þe chateus with &slong;trencþe lette
Ake þe king hem scholde wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase is howene fette
Fo&rrot; al þat þe kingus feloun hath &punctelev; þe kingus catel it is
And ech man in holi churche &punctelev; is owene take iwis.
Seint Thomas grauntede bluþeliche &punctelev; þeos and oþure mo
Ake þeos oþere he withseide &punctelev; þat dude him muche wo
[Ia contradicta.]¶ Ȝif bitwene tweie lewede men &punctelev; were ani &slong;triuingue
Oþur bituene a lewed man and a clerk &punctelev; fo&rrot; holi churche þingue
Ase fo&rrot; Avouweson of churche &punctelev; ȝweþur scholde þe churche ȝiue
Þe king wolde þat In in his court &punctelev; þat plai scholde beon id&rrot;iue
¶ fo&rrot; ase muche ase a lewed Man man &punctelev; þe o part&ydot;e was
clanliche onder þe kingue &punctelev; and onder no bischop nas.
[ija.]¶ An oþur lawe was þat no bischop &punctelev; ne clerk noþemo
Scholde out of engelonde Engelonde &punctelev; withoute þe kingus leue go
And þanne heo scholden swerien heo&rrot;e oth &punctelev; opon þe boke iwis
Þat heo ne scholden purchaci non vuel &punctelev; þe kingue ne none of his.
[iija.]¶ Þe þridde was ȝif ani man &punctelev; In mansingue were ib&rrot;ouȝt
And sethþe come to amendement &punctelev; and aȝen riȝte nere nouȝt
Þat he ne scholde nouȝt swerie opon þe boke &punctelev; ake bo&rrot;ewes finde he scholde
to &slong;tonde to al þat holi churche &punctelev; with riȝte him lokie wolde.
[iiija.]¶ Þe ferþe was þat no man &punctelev; þat of þe kinge heolde ouȝt
In chief oþur In in seruise &punctelev; in mansingue nere ib&rrot;ouȝt
bote þe wardeins of holi churche &punctelev; brouȝte[al. þat b&rrot;.] him þerto
Þat[al. þe k&ydot;ng s.] seiden oþur is baillifs &punctelev; ȝwat he hadde misdo
And lokede fo&rrot;me&slong;t ȝweþer heo wolden &punctelev; to amendement it b&rrot;inge
And bote hu&ydot; wolden bi heo&rrot;e leue &punctelev; þanne don þe mansingue.
[va.]¶ Þe fifte was þat no bischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; ne non Abbeie also[al. þat bischop&rrot;iches & abba&ydot;es also]
Þat were vo&ydot;de withoute p&rrot;elat &punctelev; In þe kingus hond were Ido
And þe king scholde al þat lond &punctelev; ase is owene take
Fo&rrot;to atþe la&slong;te þat him lu&slong;te &punctelev; ani p&rrot;elat make
And þanne scholde þilke p&rrot;elat &punctelev; of is chapele ichose beo
Of is clerkus ȝwuch þat he wolde &punctelev; þat benefiz to biseo
And þanne ȝwane he were ichose &punctelev; In is chapele þere
homage he scholde don to him &punctelev; are he jconfermed were.
[vja.]¶ Þe sixte was ȝif ani plait &punctelev; to chapitle were id&rrot;awe
And ani man made ani apel &punctelev; ȝif men duden him aȝen lawe
Þat to þe bischop fram þe Ercedekne &punctelev; his apel [he][om.] scholde make
And fram þe bischop to þe Erchebischop &punctelev; and sethþe non herre take
bote þe Erchebischopes court &punctelev; to riȝte him wolle[r. wolde] b&rrot;inge
Þat he scholde fram þulke court &punctelev; bicleopien to þe kinge
And fram þe kinge non herre &punctelev; so þat atþenende
Þe pla&ydot;dingue fram holi churche &punctelev; to þe kingue scholde iwende
And þe king amendi scholde &punctelev; þe Erchebischopes dede
And beon chief of holi churche &punctelev; ake seint Seint
thomas Thomas it withseide
[vija.]¶ Þe seueþe was þat pla&ydot;dingue &punctelev; þat of dette were
fo&rrot;to ȝelde þo&rrot;uȝ treuþe ipliȝt &punctelev; and nouȝt iholde nere
Alþei it þo&rrot;uȝ treuþe were &punctelev; þe pla&ydot;dinge scholde beon ib&rrot;ouȝt
bifo&rrot;e þe kinge and is baillifs &punctelev; and to holi churche nouȝt.
[viija.]¶ Þe eiȝteþe was þat In in þe londe &punctelev; citation non nere
Þo&rrot;uȝ bulle of þe pope of rome Rome &punctelev; Ake clanliche bileued were.
[ixa.]¶ Þe Ninþe was þat peteres Peteres
panes Panes &punctelev; þat men gaderiez mani on
Þe pope nere nouȝt on isend &punctelev; ake þe kingue euerechon.
[xa.]¶ Þe teoþe was ȝif ani clerk &punctelev; ase felun were itake
And fo&rrot; kingus felon jp&rrot;oued were &punctelev; and he ne miȝte nouȝt fo&rrot;sake
Þat men scholden fur&slong;t deso&rrot;deini him &punctelev; and sethþe þo&rrot;uȝ riȝte lawe
And þo&rrot;uȝ riȝt Iuggement of þe londe &punctelev; bringe him of lijfdawe.
Þeos cu&slong;tomes and manie oþere &punctelev; þe king pulte fo&rrot;th anon
And het þo&rrot;uȝout al þis lond &punctelev; þat Men heom heolden echon
Þene feo&rrot;þe dai bifo&rrot;e candelemasse &punctelev; þo þis was ido
Þe king het seint Seint
thomas Thomas anon &punctelev; and þe oþere bischopus also
On þis chartre heo&rrot;e seles sette &punctelev; þat non afturtale nere
Þat þulke co&slong;tomes weren iholde &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ al þe londe þere
Sire sire quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; fo&rrot; godes Godes loue þin o&rrot;e
to conseili us betere ȝif us fur&slong;t &punctelev; are we speken herof mo&rrot;e"
So þat respit was þarof Inome &punctelev; and ech wende In in his side
¶ Seint thomas Thomas nam þat transcrit &punctelev; and nolde no lengo&rrot;e abide
to
winche&slong;tre Winchestre he wende þanne &punctelev; with so&rrot;uwe and care inovȝ
hov he miȝte holi churche schilde &punctelev; fram þis muchele wovȝ
ȝwane oþur Men weren fa&slong;te aslepe &punctelev; he wep and siȝte so&rrot;e
And Iesus[al. & bad god God ] helpe holi churche" &punctelev; and cride him milce and o&rrot;e
he isai þat þer nas bote o wei &punctelev; oþur he mo&slong;te &slong;tif beo
Oþur holi churche was al bineþe &punctelev; þat with riȝte was so freo
So&rrot;i and careful he was Inov &punctelev; þat he tok on so
Fo&rrot;to entri into Answere &punctelev; þare he ne ouȝte nouȝt to do
Þat he afeng þat transcrit &punctelev; and respit hadde ibede
Fo&rrot; him þouȝte þat alholi churche &punctelev; In þat he misdude
Fo&rrot; holi churche ne scholde &punctelev; In none &slong;tude &slong;tonde to dome
Ne Ansuerie kinge ne p&rrot;ince noþur &punctelev; bote þe pope of rome Rome
¶ Þe deol þat thomas Thomas makede &punctelev; no tounge telle ne ma&ydot;
Louerd he seide "alas alas &punctelev; þat ich euere isaiȝ þis da&ydot;
Þat ich þe warde of holi churche &punctelev; so folliche scholde take
And so freo ase heo was er &punctelev; þus þeu sethþe hire make
heo þat was er so heiȝ and freo &punctelev; bi mine Aunce&slong;tres da&ydot;e
Þat ich hire scholde bineoþe b&rrot;inge &punctelev; Allas and so bitraie
fo&rrot; þis Mart&ydot;rs þat ȝw&ydot;lene weren &punctelev; fo&rrot; hire to &slong;tronge deþe ido
heo is nouþe þev þo&rrot;uȝ me imaked &punctelev; Allas ȝwi dude ich so
lu&ydot;tel wu&ydot;rth ich am of holi churche &punctelev; wardein fo&rrot;to beo
And also vnwurthþeliche þarto inome &punctelev; þat ech man ma&ydot; iseo
Fo&rrot; ich nam nouȝt ase riȝt was &punctelev; fram none o&rrot;d&rrot;e inome
Ake fram heiȝe kingus court to holi churche &punctelev; and þat wolde vuele bicome
Of houndes ich was warde&ydot;n &punctelev; and of hauekes with þe king
And nov am wardein of soulene imaked &punctelev; and þat ne Io&ydot;neth noþing
Ich þat fo&rrot;sok min owene &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le ich was chaunceler
So manie soulene habbe to loke &punctelev; allas ȝwat schal ich her
Ich d&rrot;ede þat god God habbe me fursake &punctelev; hov tok ich on alas"
Þe deol þat þis holi man makede &punctelev; withouten ende it was
he wep and siȝte n&ydot;ȝt and dai &punctelev; and heold him al fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
Ȝif he miȝte asoilled beo &punctelev; to þe pope he wolde þerfo&rrot;e
And wende toward Caunterburi. &punctelev; sone þe kinge men tolde
Þat þe Erchebischop nolde nouȝt &punctelev; þe newe &slong;tatuz holde
Þe king het his baillifs sone &punctelev; and sende aboute is sonde
Þat heo scholden greui seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; oueral on is londes
¶ Þis baillifs weren p&rrot;e&slong;te inovȝ &punctelev; and ope is maneres wel fa&slong;te
Nomen is bodene and greueden him &punctelev; heo wenden þarewith him aga&slong;te
Seint thomas Thomas let heom al iwo&rrot;þe &punctelev; and opon o&rrot;e louerd is heo&rrot;te ca&slong;te

Louerdingus he seide "we habbez ispeke &punctelev; fa&slong;te of þusse þinge
And also fer fo&rrot;th ase we mowen &punctelev; we wollez pa&ydot;e þe kinge
Ake fo&rrot; we nabbeth nouȝt iredi here &punctelev; ore conseil alclene
Fo&rrot;to þe nexte daie we biddez fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat ȝe it graunti nouþe ene
So þat heom was respit igraunted &punctelev; and ech wende in is weiȝe
Manie of seint Seint
thomas Thomas men &punctelev; bilefden him fo&rrot; eiȝe
And kniȝtes þat with him weren &punctelev; alle fram him heo d&rrot;owe
Seint thomas Thomas nam pouere men &punctelev; bi þe weie inowe
And ladde hem to is In in ne &punctelev; and to þe mete heom sette
he seruede heom is owene bodi &punctelev; And inovȝ mete and d&rrot;inke heom fette
Þis beoth he seide " godes Godes kniȝtes &punctelev; þis oþur men me habbeth fo&rrot;|sake
Þeos kniȝtes ich loue mo&rrot;e &punctelev; to heom ichulle me take
Þene sonenda&ydot; þare nas no court iholde &punctelev; fo&rrot; it was an heiȝda&ydot;
And þe Monenda&ydot; so&rrot;e s&ydot;k &punctelev; þe bischop thomas Thomas la&ydot;
In þe s&ydot;knesse of maldeflanke &punctelev; þat to him ofte cam
And fo&rrot; þe care þat he was In in ne &punctelev; wel þe wo&rrot;se him nam
Men seiden þat he makede him sik &punctelev; fo&rrot; he ne do&rrot;&slong;te to court wende
Þe king in grete wrathþe inovȝ &punctelev; after him gan sende
Wel ȝe iseoth quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; þat Ine ma&ydot; come nouȝt
Fo&rrot;soþe tomo&rrot;uwe ichulle &punctelev; hovso ich beo þudere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þei ich schulle beo þudere ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; In baruwe oþur In in bere
Þudere ichulle þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; cri&slong;t me helpe þere
Amo&rrot;ewe þane t&ydot;wesda&ydot; Tywesday &punctelev; ore louerd him gan arere
Þe fur&slong;te dai after seint Seint lucus dai &punctelev; ase it fallez In in þe ȝere
Þat dai he auȝte onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; and mani an oþur also
Fo&rrot; bi cu&slong;tome alle is grete anu&ydot; &punctelev; bi tw&ydot;esdai Twyesdai cam him to
Alle þe bischopes þane t&ydot;wesda&ydot; Tywesday &punctelev; erliche to him wende
And seiden "sire þov art in feble point &punctelev; god it þe amende
We habbez o&rrot;e red þarof inome &punctelev; and mid one mouþe echon
to queme þe kinge we redez þe &punctelev; hovso it euere gon
Oþur he þe wole bere on hond &punctelev; þat þov art is traitur
And furswo&rrot;e ȝwo&rrot;e[al. ȝwane þu swo&rrot;e] him to don &punctelev; eo&rrot;þelich honovr
And ne do&slong;t him non ake tricherie &punctelev; he þe wole bere on honde
And binime þe þi &slong;tat &punctelev; and perantur b&rrot;ingue þe out of londe
¶ "Mine leoue b&rrot;eþren quad seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ȝe iseoz wel echon
Þat al þe wo&rrot;ld grat on me one &punctelev; and alle [beoz] mine fon
And þat [is] ȝu&ydot;t me&slong;t reuþe of alle &punctelev; þat ȝe þat mine b&rrot;eþren beoz
And me þei ich sunful beo &punctelev; ouwer fader In in to&rrot;ment iseoz
Ȝe beoz mine me&slong;te fon of alle &punctelev; and also ȝe bez alȝare
In seculer court to demen me &punctelev; and þat nolde nouȝt wel fare
Fo&rrot; ȝe habbez þis among ov toda&ydot; &punctelev; bispeke sw&ydot;þe ilome
Nov god God helpe alholi churche &punctelev; and take þarto gome
Ake In in obedience ich ov hote &punctelev; þat ȝe þareneiȝ ne beon
Ȝif ich am ib&rrot;ouȝt to Iuggement &punctelev; ake þat ȝe raþur fleon
And ȝif ani man hond on ov[al. me] set &punctelev; ich ov hote also
Þat ȝe þe sentence of holi churche &punctelev; fo&rrot; swuche violence ȝe[om. ȝe] do
And holdez vp holi churche riȝte &punctelev; þat ov is bitake
Man ne schal fo&rrot; none d&rrot;ede of deþe &punctelev; hire riȝtes fo&rrot;sake
Þe bischopes weren þo wroþe inouȝ &punctelev; ant wenden to court echone
Nou god God helpe þis holi man &punctelev; fo&rrot; he was þare al one
bote þe bischop of w&ydot;nche&slong;tre Wynchestre w&ydot;nche&slong;tre &punctelev; þere ne lefde with him nouȝt on
And Iocelin þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; þat ne weren alle fram him igon
¶ Þis holi man tru&slong;te muche to god God &punctelev; and greiþed him anon
And song ane Masse of seinte Seinte &slong;teuene &punctelev; are he come among is fon
he song þulke masse ilome &punctelev; fo&rrot; also heo biginnez
Þe fur&slong;te offiz is p&rrot;op&rrot;e inov &punctelev; to þe &slong;tat þat he was In in ne
Þe biginninge of þulke masse &punctelev; In englischs Englischs so is þis
Fo&rrot; ȝwane þe p&rrot;inces habbez isete &punctelev; and aȝen heom men spekez[al. aȝen me speke] iwis
And luþere men pursiweden me &punctelev; louerd min help þov beo"[Ps. 119.]
Manie seiden þat þis iheo&rrot;den &punctelev; novþe we mouwen wel iseo
Þat he singuth þis Masse fo&rrot; þenones &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe kinge and fo&rrot; alle his
And þat he halt heom alle luþere &punctelev; þat aȝen him spekez iwis
Þis wo&rrot;d cam to court wel sone &punctelev; ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ heo weren echon
In þe mo&rrot;e wrathþe aȝein him &punctelev; and wel þe mo&rrot;e is fon
¶ Þo seint Seint
thomas Thomas hadde is masse isongue &punctelev; his chesible he gan of weue
Alle is oþur ue&slong;timenz &punctelev; on him he let bileue
Oþur Armure nadde he non &punctelev; fo&rrot; holi churche to fiȝte
Aboue he ca&slong;te is cope &punctelev; þat bifeol to is riȝte
he tok godes Godes flechs and is blod &punctelev; with him swiþe &slong;tilleliche
Ane Creo&ydot;z he nam in is hond &punctelev; and wende fo&rrot;th baldeliche
Þe ue&slong;timenz was is Armure &punctelev; ase bifeol to swuche ane kniȝte
Þe fourme of þe creoiz was is baner &punctelev; fo&rrot; holi churche to fiȝte
Fo&rrot;th wende þis guode kniȝt &punctelev; among alle is fon
Swete Iesus beo is help &punctelev; oþur frend nadde he non
Þe creoiz in is hond he bar fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and arerde op is baner
Þe bischop Robert of
herefo&rrot;d Hereford &punctelev; bigan to gon him ner
Sire he seide "ich crie þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; þi chapele&ydot;n ich mote beo
bifo&rrot;e þe lat me bere þe croiz &punctelev; fo&rrot; it ne fallez nouȝt to þe
Þe ȝw&ydot;le ich hire bere quad seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; and þe fourme iseo
Ich ne d&rrot;ede me of no man &punctelev; þe hardio&rrot;e ich ma&ydot; beo
Þanne seide þe bischop of londone Londone &punctelev; þat euere was is fo
Ine rede nouȝt þat þou bifo&rrot;e þe kingue &punctelev; In sw&ydot;che manere go
Fo&rrot; wrathi he wole him anon &punctelev; and awreken him In in þe place
¶ "Ich bitake me quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; al to godus grace
Þov ha&slong;t euere al þi lif þis oþur seide &punctelev; a muche fol ibeo
And þi folie nelt neuere bileue &punctelev; ase men mai nouþe iseo
[Curia.]Þis holi Man man wiz is creoiz &punctelev; Into þis court gan gon
[Rex.]And þo þe king isaiȝ him so come &punctelev; he wrathþede him anon
¶ "Louerdinges he seide "here ȝe iseoz &punctelev; hov þis man me schent
In ȝwuche manere is he In in to þis court &punctelev; among us hidere iwent
Ase þei we ne lefden nouȝt on cri&slong;tindom &punctelev; ne In in
godes Godes name
Ne mot ich nedes awreke me &punctelev; ne doth he me gret schame"
Þo seide al þe court anon &punctelev; sire wel ȝe mouwen iseo
Þat [he] is p&rrot;ouȝt and contecko&rrot; &punctelev; and euere hath ibeo
In despijt of þe and alle þine &punctelev; þis dede he hath ido
Fo&rrot; ȝif þou wolt þou miȝt beon iwar &punctelev; eftsone to take on so
to b&rrot;inge men In in so gret povwer &punctelev; swiche ase he is
to beon þe hexte of þine londe &punctelev; ase þou made&slong;t him iwis
Þarefo&rrot;e we ne bimenez þe nouȝt &punctelev; þou nolde&slong;t beo iwar bifo&rrot;e
We seggez bi him echone &punctelev; þat he is pu&ydot;rliche fo&rrot;swo&rrot;e
And ase bi a swuch Man man þou do bi him &punctelev; and ase bi þine fon
Fo&rrot; he þe swo&rrot; eo&rrot;thþelich honur &punctelev; and nele don þe non
Þe budeles and þe oþur schrewes &punctelev; grenneden on him fa&slong;te
And euere abiden þe kinges he&slong;te &punctelev; In p&rrot;isone him to ca&slong;te
¶ Þe king let crie anon aboute &punctelev; ȝif ani so wod were
Þat &slong;tode In in conseile wit seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; oþur felauȝschipe him bere
Ase þe kingus traitour &punctelev; Men scholden him nime anon
And laten him al one &slong;tonde &punctelev; and fondi ȝwodere he wolde gon ()
Þe bischop of Ecce&slong;tre to seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; he feol adoun akne
Fo&rrot; godes Godes loue þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; fo&rrot; so&rrot;uwes þat þov miȝt ise
haue reuþe of þe and of us &punctelev; oþur þou wolt us alle schende
Alle we wo&rrot;þez ib&rrot;ouȝt to nouȝte &punctelev; bote þov þi þouȝt wende
Sire bischop quad seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ase wel þou miȝt be &slong;tille
go henne fram me ȝif þov wolt &punctelev; and lat ech man don is wille
Þe bischopes wenden togadere echone &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e conseil nome
And þo heo hadden heo&rrot;e fourme iset &punctelev; to þe kinge aȝen heo come
¶ "Sire heo seiden "ȝe beoth anu&ydot;d &punctelev; and þat us fo&rrot;þinchez so&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;ȝif us þat ȝe on us berez &punctelev; we nellez þe misdon nonmo&rrot;e
Wel we wutez þat þis wrechche &punctelev; þat scholde o&rrot;e chief beo
he is fals and fo&rrot;swo&rrot;en &punctelev; and [þat][om.] mai ech man wel iseo
Fo&rrot; he suo&rrot; to holde þe eo&rrot;þelich honur &punctelev; and hath ib&rrot;oke is oth
And þat man mai wel p&rrot;oui on him &punctelev; ȝif ȝe nellez nouȝt beo wroth
Furȝif us þine wrathþe we biddez þe &punctelev; ant to rome Rome we wollez wende
to binimen him is Erchebischop&rrot;iche &punctelev; and ase a wrechche him schende
Pu&ydot;rliche fo&rrot;suo&rrot;e we schullen him p&rrot;eoui &punctelev; sire king bi eovwer rede
Þe king bihet heom gret honur &punctelev; to don þat ilke dede
to seint Seint
thomas Thomas þare he was &punctelev; heo wenden alle anon
Þe bischop h&ydot;llarie of Chiche&slong;tre &punctelev; tolde fo&rrot; heom echon
Sire he seide "o&rrot;e go&slong;tliche fader &punctelev; þov were herebifo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; fader we fursaketh [þe] &punctelev; þov art fals and fo&rrot;swo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þou suo&rrot;e þe k&ydot;nge eo&rrot;þelich honour &punctelev; and nelt don him non
Þarefo&rrot;e to þe court of rome Rome &punctelev; we bicleopiez þe echon
to ansuerien us bifo&rrot;e þe pope &punctelev; of þat þov ha&slong;t ido amis
Louerdingus quath þis holie man &punctelev; ich iheo&rrot;e wel al þis
¶ Nov suete Ihesu beo is freond &punctelev; ȝwane alle oþure were is fon
Þe king him let cleopien fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat he come fo&rrot;th anon
Þe Eo&rrot;l Robert of lece&slong;tre Lecestre &punctelev; and oþur men mani on
Comen after him and heten him sone &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe kingue gon
Louerdingues quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ȝe wu&ydot;ten wel echon
hou wel ich was with þe king &punctelev; þei ich habbe nouþe manie fon
Erchebischop he made me &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe aȝein mi wille
Fo&rrot; euere ich d&rrot;adde fo&rrot; oncunninge &punctelev; mi soule fo&rrot;to spille
¶ Þo axede ich bifo&rrot;e al þat folk &punctelev; In ȝwuche manere he me toke
Þe Mai&slong;trie of holi churche &punctelev; to wardi and to loke
holi churche me was bitake &punctelev; In eche manere so freo
Þat ich were quit of alle oþure courtes &punctelev; and ȝeot with riȝte it scholde so beo
And ȝwane holi churche is so freo &punctelev; Inelle ansuerien þe kingue
Ne non oþur in his court &punctelev; of none eo&rrot;þeliche þinge
Fo&rrot; gold ne passez nouȝt so muche &punctelev; In bounte led iwis
Also dignete of þe p&rrot;eo&slong;t &punctelev; herre þane þe kingus is
And is go&slong;tliche fader ich am &punctelev; ȝif he wolde nime ȝeme
And it nere no lawe þat þe sone &punctelev; þe fader scholde deme
Þarefo&rrot;e i segge at o wo&rrot;d &punctelev; þat Inelle me noþing take
to Iuggement of kingus court &punctelev; ake clanliche it wolle fo&rrot;sake
And take me to holi churche &punctelev; and to none erþeliche dome
And Ich bicleopie ov here echone &punctelev; to þe court of rome Rome
Al þe &slong;tat of holi churche &punctelev; and al mi dignite
¶ Þo&rrot;uȝ Ihesu cri&slong;t it beo iwardet &punctelev; ȝwan it ne mai oþur beo
And ou bischopus ich bicleopie &punctelev; to þe court of rome Rome also
fo&rrot; ȝe Anourieth mo&rrot;e ane erþeliche king &punctelev; þane ȝe god God almiȝti do
And so þo&rrot;uȝ þe riȝte of holi churche &punctelev; fram þis court ich wende
to b&rrot;inge þeos cause of holi churche &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe pope to ende
Þis holi Man man wel mildeliche &punctelev; out of þis court gan gon
Þe king and þat mid him was &punctelev; wrathþeden heom anon
heo criden on þis holi man &punctelev; and beleweden echon
Wit Also[MS. Ahso] grete no&ydot;se &punctelev; ase anie Men miȝten don
heo ne miȝten makie non mo&rrot;e cri &punctelev; þei al þe toun were afu&ydot;re
Ase[al. þane] heo duden opon þis holi man &punctelev; þat wide men it miȝten ihu&ydot;re
Þis guode man eode softe fo&rrot;th &punctelev; ase him noþing ne rouȝte
fo&rrot; ȝu&ydot;t mo&rrot;e men schenden Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þo men him to deþe b&rrot;ouȝte
he werth opon is palefrai &punctelev; and to is In in ne he wende also
Vnneþe he miȝte with is hondene &punctelev; þeos þre þingus do
blessi þat folk and bere þe croiz &punctelev; and is b&rrot;idel wisse
Þat simple folk o&rrot;n abouten him &punctelev; with Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ and blisse
fo&rrot; heo wenden þat he hadde ibeo &punctelev; atþe court fa&slong;te inome
heo þonkeden muche Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat he mo&slong;te among heom come
¶ to is In in at seint Seint And&rrot;eues &punctelev; heo siweden him fa&slong;te inovȝ
Seint thomas Thomas alle þe pouere men &punctelev; with him to þe mete he d&rrot;ovȝ
And seide "comiez here fo&rrot;th with me &punctelev; fo&rrot; mine freond ȝe beoth
Ine habbe none freond bote eov &punctelev; ase alle men nouþe iseoth
he let heom Alle fede wel &punctelev; a gret housful neiȝ
Þe guode man wel þe gladdo&rrot;e was &punctelev; þat he heom alle iseiȝ
Ase þis holi man sat at is mete &punctelev; þei he grete wille þerto nadde
Þis wo&rrot;d þat o&rrot;e louerd het &punctelev; is redare bifo&rrot;e him radde
Ȝif Men ov pursiwiet In in one toune &punctelev; Into anoþur toun ȝe fleo
Þis holi man þouȝte þat bi himself &punctelev; þat wo&rrot;d miȝte wel soth beo
And þat it godes Godes wille was &punctelev; Into An oþur londe gon
As þe holi godspel seith &punctelev; a man fo&rrot;to fleo is fon
Þis holi man was þo wel þe hardio&rrot;e &punctelev; of londe fo&rrot;to wende
Ȝwane he miȝte aschapie wel &punctelev; and god God wolde þe time sende
¶ Þo it was towar[d] eue &punctelev; twei seriaunz þare come
So&rrot;e weopinde and warneden him &punctelev; þat he sum red him nome
Fo&rrot; þe k&ydot;ngus Men hadden iswo&rrot;e &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ he&slong;te of þe kinge
Ȝwareso heo him miȝten finde &punctelev; to &slong;tronge deþe him b&rrot;inge
Seint thomas Thomas þouȝte anoþur. &punctelev; he let maken is bed aȝen niȝt
Op In in þe heie churche &punctelev; bitwene twei weuedes riȝt
Þo alle oþur men weren aslepe &punctelev; and no man nas him neiȝ
he aros up and biheold &punctelev; on þe &ydot;mage an heiȝ
bifo&rrot;e þe auter he feol don akne &punctelev; and on o&rrot;e louerd bigan to crie
And fo&rrot;me&slong;t he seide þe seuen salmes &punctelev; and sethþe þe letanie
Al wepind ech haluwe he bad &punctelev; is help fo&rrot;to beo
bifo&rrot;e ech &ydot;mage he op aros &punctelev; and eft he sat adoun akne
Þo he hadde iseid is beden &punctelev; stilleliche he gan gon
A lu&ydot;te bifo&rrot;e þe cockes crowe &punctelev; out of þe churche anon
And wende him outward of engelonde Engelonde &punctelev; þat no man with him nas
bote a frere of Semplingham &punctelev; þat wel p&rrot;iue to him was
Þis guode Man man flev al Engelond &punctelev; fo&rrot; holi churche riȝte
Of al is wo ne ȝaf he nouȝt &punctelev; ȝif he it amendi miȝte
¶ Þe tiþingue cam of þis cas &punctelev; to þe kingue ful sone
Þe heiȝe men nomen heo&rrot;e red &punctelev; ȝwat were þarof to done
Þe king and al is baronie &punctelev; and þe bischopes echon
Þat auȝten with seint Seint
thomas Thomas habbe ibe &punctelev; and weren me&slong;t is fon
to þis conseil euerechone &punctelev; heo concenteden at þen ende
Þat þe king scholde of is hexte Men &punctelev; to þe court of rome Rome sende
Aȝen him ȝwane [he] þudere come &punctelev; and þe pope don onder&slong;tonde
Þat he was fals and fo&rrot;swo&rrot;e &punctelev; and de&slong;tourbour of þe londe
Fo&rrot;to don þis grete neode &punctelev; þe wise&slong;te Men heo nome
And þat is þing were al in pais &punctelev; fo&rrot;to heo aȝen come
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwike &punctelev; and þe bischop of Ecce&slong;tre
to rome Rome [MS. rome Rome
rome Rome ] heo wenden fo&rrot; þis neodes &punctelev; and þe bischop of Cice&slong;tre
And þe bischop of londone Londone &punctelev; and of
winche&slong;tre Winchestre also
And also eo&rrot;les and barouns &punctelev; and manie clerkes þerto

Oþur certus he is ope þe po&ydot;nte &punctelev; al þat lond to spille
And þat ȝe him cha&slong;ti þo&rrot;uȝ riȝte lawe &punctelev; & binime him is fole wille
Of alle þe clerkes þat þare seten &punctelev; non of heom þar nas
Þat ne p&rrot;eisede muche þis heiȝe man &punctelev; fo&rrot; he so renable was
[papa.]¶ "Louerdingues quath þe pope &punctelev; wel we onder&slong;tondez inouȝ
Þat [ȝe] toward þe Erchebischop tellez &punctelev; with riȝte oþur with wouȝ
Ake we ne mouwen þarof non dom ȝiue &punctelev; bote himsulue here were
Fo&rrot; we ne mowen bihinden him no Iuggement ȝ&ydot;ue &punctelev; ne no riȝt iwis it nere
[comes.]¶ "Sire quath þe Eo&rrot;l of Arundel &punctelev; ȝe moten bet onder&slong;tonde
A certein dai us is iset &punctelev; to come into engelonde Engelonde
And þane dai ne do&rrot;re we nouȝt b&rrot;eke &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd þe kingue
Þarefo&rrot;e ȝe moten us grace don &punctelev; sumdel of þis þinge
Ȝe moten ȝif it is ower wille &punctelev; ane legat wis[r. wiz] us sende
And þene Erchebischope hoten also &punctelev; to Engelonde iwende
And ase þe legat þare enquereth &punctelev; þaraftur he mai do
¶ "Certes beu frere quat þe pope &punctelev; Inelle nouȝt take on so
Ȝwane þe erchebischop hidere comez &punctelev; Inot ȝwat he wole telle
Þarefo&rrot;e are ich iheo&rrot;e him speke &punctelev; noþing don þarof inelle
Certes sire seide þis oþur &punctelev; we ne do&rrot;ren abide nouȝt
Nov de pardeus quath þe pope &punctelev; doth ase ȝe habbeth iþouȝt"
Þis oþure weren wroþe inouȝ. &punctelev; wel faire heo&rrot;e leue heo nome
And wenden heom fo&rrot;th in grete wrathþe &punctelev; And to londone Londone heo come.
Seint Thomas was þo In in
Flaund&rrot;es &punctelev; In hu&ydot;dinge ase þei it were
In þe Abbeie of seint Seint Bert&ydot;n &punctelev; and longe he hadde ibeo þere
Atþe la&slong;te he aros bi niȝte &punctelev; and out of Flaund&rrot;es wende
Al p&rrot;iueliche In in to Fraunce &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd him grace sende
Þe king of Fraunce þat was þo &punctelev; louwis guod and hende
heo&rrot;de telle of þis holi Man man &punctelev; he let sone after him sende
Þo þis holi Man man to him cam &punctelev; gret Io&ydot;e ioye he gan him make
And het him in eche &slong;tude opon is lond &punctelev; jnovȝ of his take
¶ to spene to him and alle his &punctelev; ȝwareso heo euere come
Nolde seint Seint
thomas Thomas nouȝt abide &punctelev; are he come to rome Rome
Þe king him fond spence inovȝ &punctelev; to him and alle his
And sende with him guod condu&ydot;t &punctelev; to b&rrot;inge him þare iwis
¶ þo seint Seint
thomas Thomas to Rome cam &punctelev; faire he was onderfonge
And sumdel þe pope was anu&ydot;d &punctelev; þat he hadde ibeo so longe
Men acoupeden him of þulke trespas &punctelev; þat þe bischopes tolden er
And beden him ansuerie fo&rrot; is &slong;tat &punctelev; and aleggi þarefo&rrot;e þer
Seint thomas Thomas wolde op arise &punctelev; Men beden him sitte adoun
And he bigan a godes Godes name &punctelev; and schewede þis reson
Sire he seide "ich am Imaked &punctelev; þei ich onwu&ydot;rth beo
to wardi þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; ase ȝe mowen iseo
Þulke churche was iwoned to beo &punctelev; Ase lauedi and sch&ydot;nde wide
briȝte ase þe sonne among alle oþure &punctelev; of al þe we&slong;tside
Þe sonne þat was ero&rrot;e so cler &punctelev; deo&rrot;k heo is bicome
brode cloude and &slong;trongue inouȝ þat[om. þat] hire liȝt habbeth binome
Ouerca&slong;t heo is with þis cloudene þat heo ne ȝifth lijȝt non
And alle þe churchene of Engelonde deo&rrot;ke beoth echon
Þe k&ydot;ng þat hire scholde upholde he binimez al hire riȝte
And ase þe cloudene hire ouerca&slong;t þat heo ne mai no leng liȝte
Ich þat scholde hire wardein beo þareaȝein ich mot fiȝte
And &slong;tonde aȝen and withsegge þe luþere co&slong;tomes bi al mi miȝte
Fo&rrot; þei ich hadde a þovsend liues ase ich nabbe bote on
raþur þane ich it þolie wolde ȝ&ydot;ue ich wolde echon
Þe co&slong;tomes aȝen holi churche þat þe king hath fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
here ȝe mouwen heom iheo&rrot;e ȝif heo buth to graunti ouȝt
¶ Þis holi man bigan to rede þe luþere lawene ase he heom hadde iwrite
he wep þat þe teres o&rrot;nen adoun þat deol it was to wite
Þe pope and alle is cardinales þat seiȝen him wepe so so&rrot;e
And heo&rrot;dene alle þe luþere lawene heo ne miȝten fo&rrot;bere non|mo&rrot;e
Ake bigonnen to wepe fa&slong;te echone and hereden god God also
Þat heo miȝten finde a swuch p&rrot;elat ouer holi churche ido
Þat holi churche so heold to riȝte and ne soffrede no wovȝ
heo þonkeden god God of swuch a Man man and honoureden him inovȝ
Þe pope het is clerkes alle þat[om. þat] þo&rrot;uȝ al cri&slong;tindome
Þat heo witseiden su&ydot;che luþere lawes ȝwareso hu&ydot; euere come
And[om. And] þat heo neren isoffrede nouȝware hovso heo comen to ende
And þat heo ȝeuen heo&rrot;e lijf þarefo&rrot;e raþur þane holi churche schende
[Thomas]¶ Þo spac eftsone seint Seint
thomas Thomas wepinde sw&ydot;þe so&rrot;e
Inabbe nouȝt he seide "so muche wo þat inere wurþe wel mo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;trencþe of eo&rrot;þeliche manne In in þis pouwer ich am ido
Ake ich me d&rrot;ede aȝen godes Godes wille it be fo&rrot; onwu&ydot;rth ich am þarto
Þarefo&rrot;e o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; riȝte wreche vuel biginninge me deth sende
And ich d&rrot;ede fo&rrot; mine wrechche gultes þat wo&rrot;se wo&rrot;th þe ende
Þarefo&rrot;e þat holi churche ne beo to grounde ib&rrot;ouȝt
Fo&rrot; mine sunnes and fo&rrot; mine onmiȝte þat Ine ma&ydot; hire wardi nouȝt
Ich ȝelde ov op here þe bischop&rrot;iche an oþer ȝe moten þare do
Þat mowe bet loki holi churche fo&rrot; onwu&ydot;rth ich am þarto
¶ his R&ydot;ng he nam and bitok þe pope and op ȝeld þe bischop&rrot;iche
Þe pope swiþe deolfulliche and wel In in liche bigan to siche
Þerof conseillede al þe court ȝwat þe be&slong;te red were
to laten him witien holi churche oþur to don anoþur þere
Me þinchez quath a cardinal " In in swuch cas ase nouþe is
be&slong;t it were to don an oþur In in his &slong;tude iwis
Fo&rrot;to paien bet þe kinge and swuc[h] cas miȝte bifalle
Þat þe k&ydot;ng wolde aswagi and bileue is luþere lawene alle
Fo&rrot; betere it were In in faire manere hoso it miȝte to ende b&rrot;ingue
Þane contec arere In in swuche londe and nameliche aȝen þe kingue
And man miȝte purveien þis gode manne an also guod ase þat is
Ine wot ȝwat conseil ȝe wollez rede fo&rrot; ichulle reden þis
Þo seide an oþur cardinal " In in e rede nouȝt so iwis
Fo&rrot; þat wolde ȝiuen men ansaumple al dai to don amis
Fo&rrot; ȝwane þe king were wroth with ani bischop fo&rrot; anie cunnes þinge
to don þane bischop anon adoun þe mo vuele lawene he wolde b&rrot;inge
And þanne were holi churche ischend þat lauedi scholde be
Fo&rrot; þis red me þinchez feble a betere ȝe moten biseo
[papa.]¶ Þe pope nam þo seint Seint
thomas Thomas and tok him aȝein is ring
to bileue erchebischop fo&rrot;th and &slong;table þo&rrot;uȝ alle þing
studefa&slong;tliche to holden up alholi churche riȝte
And he him wolde aȝen ech man helpen bi is miȝte
Ake he ne scholde nouȝt þe ȝeot to engelonde Engelonde wend[e]
Ake abide betere grace of þe king ȝif god God it wolde sende
To þe grete Abbeie to pountenie Pountenie fo&rrot;to so&rrot;iourni þere
he sende þis holi Man man fo&rrot;to it betere were
With lu&ydot;tel folk and lu&ydot;tel aise þare he dude bileue
Fo&rrot; he nadde himsulf nouȝt to spene bote ase heo him ȝeue
his men he b&rrot;oȝte In in seruise heo&rrot;e mete to w&ydot;nne þere
And himsulf he was al one neiȝ þei he heiȝ Man man were
hard lijf he ladde inovȝ And he hadde of harde here
Schu&ydot;rte and b&rrot;ech &slong;treit inovȝ hardo&rrot;e neuere nere
Þe &slong;trapeles weren swiþe &slong;treite with mani a knotte also
Anon to is þies þe schu&ydot;rte tilde þe b&rrot;ech riȝt to is to
Þe knottes gnowen al is flechs aboute bi eche side
Swiþe onaisi was is b&rrot;ech aboute fo&rrot;to ride
harde miȝte he sitte adoun and harde ligge also
Louerd deo&rrot;e abouȝte he heuene wel auȝte he come þerto
¶ Þe bischopes of Engelonde þat aȝein him weren at rome Rome
Þe Eo&rrot;les and þe oþere heiȝe Men þo heo to Engelond come
heo tolden þe kinge al heo&rrot;e cas hov heo hadde isped
Þo was þe king boþe so&rrot;i and wroth þat he was neiȝ awed
¶ "A he seide "þilke traitour þat ich habbe fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat he me schal swuch schame don nouþe In in e ma&ydot; it þolie nouȝt
And he fleuȝth[r. fleuȝch] out of londe þat In in e ma&ydot; to him come
Ichulle me of is cunne awreke heo schullen abugge some
he let seche out clene al is kun and is oþur frend echon
Ovt of Engelonde he let heom d&rrot;iue þat þare ne mo&slong;te leue non
Sike ne feble . ȝung ne old ne womman þat was with childe
Ne þe child&rrot;en þat soukinde weren muche was he onmilde
In hire Armes armes þe moder bar þat child and In in heo&rrot;e wombene some
Þare hadde þe king ase me þinchez a feble wreche inome
Iharlede heo weren in grete Miseise out of londe alas
Ech guod man hadde revþe of heom þat heo&rrot;den of þat cas
And seiden &slong;tilleliche bitwene heom þat he a luþur king was
Mo luþere dedene þe king biþouȝte ȝeot ope seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Þeos Men þat he of londe d&rrot;of were heom lef oþur loth
Ech aftur oþur he made heom swerie opon a boke gret oth
Þat heo ne scholden in none &slong;tude bileue none &slong;tounde
Are heo to þe Erchebischope comen ȝwareso heo him founden
And tellen him fo&rrot;e hov heo weren out of londe ib&rrot;ouȝt
to b&rrot;ingue him jn þe mo&rrot;e so&rrot; ȝif heo miȝten tu&ydot;rne is þouȝt
¶ Ȝeot þe king biþouȝte a luþer dede mo&rrot;e ope seint Seint
thomas Thomas
he fo&rrot;bed þo&rrot;uȝ al Engelond ase fer ase his pouwer was
Þat no man ne scholde fo&rrot; him bidde In in churche ne elles ȝware
Ase men doth nouþe fo&rrot; Erchebischopes and habbez idon wel ȝare
Louerd muche was þe schame þo þat holi churche bitidde
Ȝwane heo ne mo&slong;te among oþur men fo&rrot; so holi a man bidde
Þat folk of seint Seint
thomas Thomas kunne wel þicke abouten him d&rrot;ouȝ
Aldai heo weren iflemde fo&rrot; him In in miseise and so&rrot;uwe inouȝ
Heo weopen and criden deolfulliche &punctelev; and tolden him al heo&rrot;e cas
hov heo weren fo&rrot; him defoulede &punctelev; and ȝwuch ho&rrot;e so&rrot;uwe was
Seint thomas Thomas biheold heom deolfolliche &punctelev; and bigan to siche so&rrot;e
And euere he makede fair semblaunt &punctelev; to confo&rrot;ti heom þe mo&rrot;e
And seide þis wo&rrot;d to gladie hem &punctelev; þat men onder&slong;toden wel longe
Ech lond he seide "is owene contreie &punctelev; to þulke þat beoth &slong;tronge"
Ase Man man þat seith þei ȝe beon here &punctelev; In vnkouþe londe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝif ȝe beoth &slong;tronge in godes Godes lawe &punctelev; it ne schal ov greui nouȝt
Alle þe heiȝe men of þe londe &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;den of þat cas
Co&rrot;seden þe kinge and seiden also &punctelev; þat he a luþur man was
Þis selie men aboute men nomen &punctelev; fo&rrot; loue of seint Seint
thomas Thomas
And founden heom liflode inouȝ &punctelev; þat in miseise neuer on nas.
Þo þeos tiþinges to þe kingue &punctelev; of Engelonde cam
þat þis folk was wel onderfonge &punctelev; gret deol to him he nam
Certes he seide "ȝwane Ine ma&ydot; &punctelev; in þis manere is heo&rrot;te bu&ydot;e
In mo&rrot;e miseise ichulle him b&rrot;inge &punctelev; þat is lijf him schal anu&ydot;e
¶
Gre&ydot;e greye
Monekes monekes of Ci&slong;tevs &punctelev; fram ȝere to ȝere
A Chapitre makeden generale &punctelev; of Abbodes abbodes þat þere were
Fo&rrot; euerech Abbod of greie Monekes &punctelev; to þulke chapitle cam
With In in ne þre ȝer[al. a terme] ase [hu&ydot;] ȝu&ydot;t doth &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ al cri&slong;tindom
Þo þe chapitle plenere was &punctelev; þudere þe king sende
to þe Abbotus alle plenereliche &punctelev; þat to þulke chapitle wende
And sende heom wo&rrot;d þat him þouȝte wunder &punctelev; mo&rrot;e þane inouȝ
Þat heo wolden him so muche do &punctelev; onku&ydot;nde dedes and wouȝ
fo&rrot;to su&slong;tein&ydot; is wiþerw&ydot;ne &punctelev; among heom and is fo
In þe house of pountene&ydot;e Pounteneye &punctelev; þat b&rrot;ouȝte him in swuch wo
And bote heo wolden him bileue &punctelev; and ne su&slong;te&ydot;ni him nonmo&rrot;e
Alle þe gre&ydot;e Monekes of Engelonde &punctelev; abugge it scholden so&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; heo su&slong;teineden is fo &punctelev; ne[r. no] wonder he seide it nere
Þei he awreke him of þat hous &punctelev; þat ine his londe were
Þo þeos lettres to Ci&slong;teus &punctelev; among þis Abbotes come
Of þe þretningue heo d&rrot;adden heom so&rrot;e &punctelev; and conseil þarof heo nome
So þat heo beden seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; his he&slong;te fo&rrot;to do
Fo&rrot; heo ne do&rrot;&slong;ten nouȝt aȝen þe kingus wille &punctelev; nonmo&rrot;e holden him so
Þo seint Seint
thomas Thomas þis iheo&rrot;de &punctelev; he gan fo&rrot;to siche so&rrot;e
And bad Ihesu cri&slong;t him helpe þo &punctelev; and cride him milce and o&rrot;e
¶ "Louerdingus ȝe þat habbez me &punctelev; Isu&slong;te&ydot;ned mani a da&ydot;[Thomas.]
In mine grete neode Ihesu cri&slong;t it ov ȝelde &punctelev; þare ich misulf ne mai
Þe king þretnez ov so fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat ȝif[r. ȝif þat] ȝe holdez me here ouȝt longe
Ȝif cri&slong;t wole ȝe ne schullen neuere &punctelev; fo&rrot; me harm afongue
Ȝwareso ich euere mai on eo&rrot;þe beo &punctelev; fram eov ichulle wende
Þat ȝe ne beon fo&rrot; me apeirede &punctelev; ore louerd is grace me sende
Þat ȝe habbeth on me ispend &punctelev; after me cometh on
Þat sw&ydot;þe wel it wole[MS. it wole it wole] aquiten &punctelev; houso it euere gon.[v. 15234 al. om.]
Fo&rrot; ich mai ȝu&ydot;t mine mete bidde &punctelev; Inam nouȝt to guod þerto
Ore louerd þat fedeth þe wilde be&slong;tes and foules &punctelev; he mai me fede also
Ake hovso it euere of me bicome &punctelev; god ȝif it is his wille
holde up þe riȝtes of holi churche &punctelev; þat heo fulliche naspille
Ase þis holi man in þouȝte &slong;tod &punctelev; ȝwodere he miȝte wende
Þe king of Fraunce þat was so guod &punctelev; sone he gan him wo&rrot;d sende
Þat he wolde bileue opon is londe &punctelev; ȝware is heo&rrot;t be&slong;t d&rrot;ouȝ
Cheose he himsulf and he wolde &punctelev; finden him spense inouȝ
Fo&rrot; it is soth iseid ȝwane a man is &punctelev; In me&slong;t so&rrot;uwe and teone
Þanne is o&rrot;e louerdes grace next &punctelev; ase it was þare isene
¶ Þis holi man nam is leue þare &punctelev; mildeliche and softe
And so&rrot;e wepinde he wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; he ȝoxede and siȝte wel ofte
[Abbas ponten.]Þe Abbot of pountene&ydot;e Pounteneye &punctelev; sumdel fo&rrot;thward him b&rrot;ouȝte
And Axede him ȝwi he were &punctelev; In so deolfule þouȝte
Ichulle þe telle quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ȝwi ich carie so
bot þat þov ne telle no man fo&rrot;e &punctelev; are mine endeda&ydot; beo ido
Ich am siker þat i schal ȝeot &punctelev; deie in Mart&ydot;rdom
[Sompnium.]Fo&rrot; toniȝt ase ich was aslepe &punctelev; a wonder[MS. ȝonder] metinge me com
¶
In in þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; me þouȝte i &slong;tod iwis
And &slong;triuede fo&rrot; holi churche &punctelev; aȝen þe kinge and his
Þo comen þere four kniȝtes gon &punctelev; and smiten me opon þe croune
Ech after oþur þat mi b&rrot;a&ydot;n &punctelev; schedde al ab&rrot;od þare doune
Fo&rrot; [me] nouþe[al. me] ich þonki Ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; þat i schal deiȝen so
Ake fo&rrot; mine Men i siche so&rrot;e &punctelev; Inot ȝwat heo schullen do
Þis holi man wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; In care and deol bi weiȝe
Fo&rrot;to he cam to senouns &punctelev; twelf mile fram pounteneie Pounteneie
[ad Senon.]¶ Þare he bilefde In in soiourninge &punctelev; alþe ȝwile þat he wolde
And þe king him fond to spene inovȝ &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
Þis guode Man man bilefde þere &punctelev; In pais and re&slong;te inovȝ
An euere he carede fo&rrot; holi churche &punctelev; þat þe king dude hire wouȝ
he sende to þe kinge of Engelonde &punctelev; þat he scholde late beo &slong;tille
And ne weo&rrot;ri non mo&rrot;e opon holi churche &punctelev; ȝif it were is wille
Sone þas[al. seþþe] þe king of Engelonde &punctelev; ase is wille him nam
Ouer se wende ase god God it wolde &punctelev; and into Fraunce he cam
¶ Þe king of Fraunce was aboute &punctelev; ȝif god God wolde him grace sende
Aco&rrot;di him and seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; ȝif he miȝte it b&rrot;inge to ende
So þat heo weren togadere ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; at one daiȝe Iset
Seint thomas Thomas cam bifo&rrot;e þe king &punctelev; and ase is louerd him gret
And to is fet fel akne &punctelev; he wep and cride is o&rrot;e
haue reuþe of holi churche &punctelev; and ne weo&rrot;re þov hire nonmo&rrot;e
And þine wille ichulle do &punctelev; ase ich seide er bi mine miȝte
Saue mine louerdes honur &punctelev; and holi churche riȝte
¶ Þe king makede him wroth inovȝ fo&rrot; þat wo&rrot;d &punctelev; ase he hadde ofte ibeo
