¶ "ȝif þe pope hath quath thomas Thomas &punctelev; In sentence ib&rrot;ouȝt[ thomas Thomas .]
heom þat habbez me misdon &punctelev; he ne mispaiez me nouȝt
[Miles.]¶ " In in eche manere þov schewe&slong;t wel" &punctelev; sire Reinaud seide þo
Fo&rrot;to anu&ydot;e o&rrot;e louerd þe king &punctelev; and þat þov art is fo
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ we iseoth wel &punctelev; þat þov wilne&slong;t to don him wo
And wolde&slong;t beo king in is &slong;tude &punctelev; ake þou ne wo&rrot;&slong;t neuere so
And ȝif þou miȝte&slong;t binime him is crovne &punctelev; ake so ne schal it nouȝt go[both lines transposed in other MSS.]
¶ "Certes bev frere quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; Ine þenche noþing þerto
Ake raþur ichulle him þerto helpe &punctelev; so muche so ich mai
And fo&rrot; him and fo&rrot; his honour &punctelev; ich bidde niȝt and dai
Fo&rrot; þare nis nouþe man on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; þat ich louie iwis
So muche ase him sauue is fader &punctelev; þat ȝeot mi louerd is
A seinte Seinte
Marie dai Maugdele&ydot;ne &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe i segge þe
Þo þe aco&rrot;d was fo&rrot;me&slong;t imaked &punctelev; bitwene mi louerd and me
he seide me þat ich lete amansi &punctelev; alle þat hadden misdo
Mine churche þat is his owene Moder moder &punctelev; and ich habbe idon so
¶ "Avo&ydot; sire p&rrot;eo&slong;t quath þis oþur &punctelev; to muche þov spext neiȝ
Þov desclaund&rrot;e&slong;t þin owene louerd &punctelev; þov ne art noþer guod ne sleiȝ
[Miles.]Sei&slong;tþov þat mi louerd þe king &punctelev; In mansinge let do
Alle þat maden is sone king &punctelev; ne consentede he þerto
Nas it al is owene dede &punctelev; and bi none oþur mannes lo&rrot;e
Avo&ydot; sire p&rrot;eo&slong;t biþench þe bet &punctelev; ne seie þov so namo&rrot;e
¶ "Certes sire quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; þou wo&slong;t wel it was so[ thomas Thomas .]
Fo&rrot; þou were þare þiself þo &punctelev; and manie oþere þerto
bischopus and Erchebischopus ek &punctelev; and oþere grete and heiȝe
Ȝe fif hund&rrot;ed men and mo &punctelev; also þov wel iseiȝe
[Miles.]¶ "beo &slong;tille quath þis luþere kniȝt &punctelev; hold þinne mouthþ ich rede
Þov missei&slong;t mi louerd þe king &punctelev; daþeit alle þat it seide
ho miȝte soffri swuch sclaund&rrot;e &punctelev; bote he nome þarof wreche
bi þe fei þat schal to god God &punctelev; man schal þe anoþur teche"
his felawes euerechone &punctelev; heo&rrot;e Armes armes ab&rrot;od ca&slong;te
And ferden ase Men þat weren wode &punctelev; and þretneden him wel fa&slong;te
to þe Monekus monekus heo wenden anon &punctelev; comieth here fo&rrot;th he seide
Ȝe holdeth here þe kingus fo &punctelev; witiez him wel ich rede
Þat ȝe to þe kingus wille &punctelev; is bodi ȝe[om. ȝe] habben alȝare
Oþur he schal ouwer londes aboute &punctelev; and ower maneres maken wel bare"
[ thomas Thomas .]¶ "Sire Re&ydot;naud quath seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; wen&slong;tþou þat ichulle fleo
Nai par deu nouȝt a fote &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe king ne fo&rrot; þe
[Miles.]¶ "bi god God sire bischop quath þis oþur &punctelev; bi þat þou wo&slong;t þen ende
Þi fleoinge schal beo lu&ydot;te wurth &punctelev; þou ne schalt nouȝt wel fer wende
Þis kniȝtes in grete wrathþe þo &punctelev; wenden heom fo&rrot;th echon
And leten heom arm&ydot; sw&ydot;þe wel &punctelev; and comen aȝen anon
W[i]th suerdes and with axes &punctelev; and with oþere armes mo
Robert de b&rrot;ok þe luþere clerk &punctelev; he was with heom þo
Into þe cloi&slong;tre of Caunterburi &punctelev; with grete no&ydot;se heo comen weue
Þe Monekus monekus songen Euesong &punctelev; fo&rrot; it was welneiȝ eue
Some fo&rrot; þe grete no&ydot;se &punctelev; fullen adoun fo&rrot; fere
And some bigonne to fleon aboute &punctelev; ase men þat witlese were
Seint thomas Thomas nam ane Cro&ydot;z &punctelev; ake oþure armes non
And þarewith wel baldeliche &punctelev; he eode aȝein is fon
Þis Monekus monekus o&rrot;nen[MS. o&rrot;nem] to him some &punctelev; sire merci heo seiden
Fo&rrot; godes Godes loue abid ȝut here &punctelev; ore louerd þe mai ȝu&ydot;t rede
Soffre þat we helpen þe &punctelev; oþur þat we with þe deiȝe
Some wolden makien þe do&rrot;en &punctelev; þo heo þat folk iseiȝe
bileuez quath þe holie Man man &punctelev; ȝe ne doth nouȝt as þe wise
Singuth fo&rrot;th ower auesong &punctelev; and doth o&rrot;e louerd is seruise
Man ne schal of holi churche &punctelev; ca&slong;tel maken non
latez foles ane &slong;tounde awede &punctelev; and in heo&rrot;e folie gon"
Þe kniȝtes comen reken In in &punctelev; heo&rrot;e folie fo&rrot;to do
And seiden "ȝware is nouþe þis traitour &punctelev; and þis false bischop also"
[ thomas Thomas .]¶ Seint
thomas Thomas bar þe Croiz on honde &punctelev; and answerede is fon
Ich am here godus p&rrot;eo&slong;t &punctelev; ake traitour nam ich non
Sechez him þat wole ov fleo &punctelev; oþur þat d&rrot;ede ovwer þretninge
Non redio&rrot;e ne beoth ower swerdes &punctelev; me to deþe b&rrot;ingue
Þat min heo&rrot;te p&rrot;e&slong;to&rrot;e nis &punctelev; þene deþ fo&rrot;to take
Fo&rrot; þe riȝtes of holi churche &punctelev; Inelle nouȝt det fo&rrot;sake
Þare wende fo&rrot;th on of heom &punctelev; and is hu&ydot;re of him d&rrot;ouȝ
And is mantel anon afterward &punctelev; with gret uilte inouȝ
Sire Re&ydot;naud le fiz ours Ours &punctelev; pursiwede him anon
¶ "Sire Re&ydot;naud quat seint Seint
thomas Thomas þo &punctelev; hov schal þis nouþe gon
Ofte ich habbe þe guod ido &punctelev; and manie oþure mo
Þov schalt sone quath þis oþur &punctelev; iwite hou it go
Traitour þou art ded anon &punctelev; non oþur nelle ich do
Fo&rrot;soþe quath þis holi man &punctelev; wel p&rrot;e&slong;t ich am þerto
Fo&rrot; þe riȝtes of holi churche &punctelev; deiȝe ichulle wel fawe
Ȝif heo miȝte þereafterward &punctelev; in pais beo and in lawe
Ak ich ov bidde ȝif ȝe sechez me &punctelev; in ovre louerdes name
Þat ȝe ne comen neiȝ non oþur man &punctelev; harm ne do ne schame
Fo&rrot; non oþur gulti nis &punctelev; of þat ȝe witez me
heo buth alle gultlese bote ich one &punctelev; þarof sikere ȝe beo
And also ase heo gultlese beoth &punctelev; harmles latez heom wende
Þe guode man sat adoun akneo &punctelev; þo he sai al þe ende
Fo&rrot;to afonge þene &slong;tronge deth &punctelev; is heued he bu&ydot;de adoun
And softe ase some iherden &punctelev; he seide þis o&rrot;esoun
[Oratio thome.]¶ "Ore louerd and seinte Seinte
Marie &punctelev; and seint Seint
Denis also
And alle þe avouwes of þis churche &punctelev; In ȝwas o&rrot;e ich am ido
Ich bitake mine soule here &punctelev; and holi churche riȝte
Ȝeot he bad fo&rrot; holi churche &punctelev; þo he nadde non oþur miȝte
Sire Re&ydot;naud le fiz ovrs Ovrs &punctelev; me&slong;t schrewe of echon
Fo&rrot;to smite þis holi man &punctelev; is swerd he d&rrot;ouȝ anon
¶ Ake Edward grim þat was is clerk &punctelev; in g[ra]unteb&rrot;ugge ibo&rrot;e
his louerd to helpe ȝif he miȝte &punctelev; his Arm he pulte bifo&rrot;e
he woundede is Arm sw&ydot;þe so&rrot;e &punctelev; þat blod o&rrot;n fa&slong;te adoun
W[i]th þulke dunte he smot also &punctelev; seint thomas Thomas ope þe croun
Þat blod o&rrot;n bi[MS. bi co&rrot;r. to to] is face adoun &punctelev; In is riȝt half of þe wounde
Lovde gradde þis luþere kniȝt &punctelev; smitez alle to grounde"
Edward grim and[MS. and and] alle is men &punctelev; þat þo aboute him were
Ato&rrot;nen aboute ech in is side &punctelev; ope þe weuedes fo&rrot; fere
Ase it bi o&rrot;e louerd ferde &punctelev; þo þe giwes Giwes him nome
his desciples flovwen anon &punctelev; men nu&slong;ten ȝware heo bicome
Fo&rrot; in þe godspel it is iwriten &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd himself seide
Ȝwane a man smit þene schepherde &punctelev; þe schep wollez tosp&rrot;ede"
And o&rrot;e louered bad fo&rrot; is desciples &punctelev; þat men ne scholden hem[MS. him] non harm do
Þaron þouȝte seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; he bad fo&rrot; is men also
An oþur kniȝt smot seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; in þulke sulue wounde
And made him bouwie is face adoun &punctelev; and loke toward þe grounde
Þe þridde in þulke sulue &slong;tude &punctelev; þareafter him smot anon
And makede him loute adoun &punctelev; is face to þe &slong;ton
In þulke &slong;tude þe feo&rrot;þe smot &punctelev; þare þe oþere hadden er ido
Þat þe point of is swerd b&rrot;ak &punctelev; In þe Marb&rrot;e ato.
¶ Ȝeot þat ilke point at Caunterburi &punctelev; þe Monekus monekus doth wite
Fo&rrot; honour of þe holi man &punctelev; þat þarewith was ismite.
With þulke &slong;troke he smot al of &punctelev; þe scholle and þe croune
Þat þut b&rrot;ain ful on þe pauement &punctelev; al ab&rrot;od þare doune
þat ȝwite b&rrot;a&ydot;n[MS. b&rrot;a&ydot;m] was imeind &punctelev; with þe rede blod þere
Þat colur was wel fair to seo &punctelev; þei ich[al. hit] reulich were
Al round it o&rrot;n aboute is heued &punctelev; ase it were a d&ydot;ademe
And alround þareabouten it la&ydot; &punctelev; ȝwareof men token grete ȝeme
Fo&rrot; ȝwane men pe&ydot;ntiez an Anletnesse[al. halewe] &punctelev; ȝe ne seoth it nouȝt bileued
Þat þere nis depeint a Roundel &punctelev; alaboute þe heued
Þat rondel men cleopiez þe diademe. &punctelev; fo&rrot; manie iseien þat cas[al. as me seȝ þer a fair cas]
bi þe diademe of is b&rrot;a&ydot;ne &punctelev; þat he holi was
Þo þis holi man imartret was &punctelev; þis kniȝtes graden echon
Þis traitour is to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; wende we henne anon
Siwieth us ȝe kingus men alle &punctelev; and alle þat with him beoth
Of þis tra&ydot;tur ȝe beoth awreke &punctelev; ase ȝe nouþe iseoth
he þouȝte beo herre þane þe king &punctelev; and binimen him is croune
And b&rrot;inge to nouȝt al engelond Engelond &punctelev; ake nouþe he lijth þare doune
Ase þe giwes Giwes bi o&rrot;e louerd seiden &punctelev; þo heo wolden him to deþe do
Þat he made him kin[g] and non nas &punctelev; and godes Godes sone also
Þo þis luþere kniȝtes weren &punctelev; fram þis holi man igon
Robert de b&rrot;ok him biþouȝte &punctelev; and turnede him aȝen anon
And þo&rrot;uȝ þe scolle smot is swerd &punctelev; deope with In in ne is heued
Þo þe scolle al amti was &punctelev; and no b&rrot;a&ydot;n In in ne bileued
Ase þe giwes Giwes leten smite o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; to þe heo&rrot;te grounde
After þe deþe with a spere &punctelev; and maden þe fifte wounde
¶ Þis luþere men alle in one &slong;tude &punctelev; smiten seint Seint
thomas Thomas
In þe scolle riȝt euene ab&rrot;od &punctelev; þare is croune was
he nas nouȝt þe man þat he wolde &punctelev; is heued enes withd&rrot;awe
Ne fondi fo&rrot;to fleo heo&rrot;e &slong;trokes &punctelev; ne enes aweiward wawe
Ne nouȝt enes groni ne makien cri &punctelev; bote mildeliche and softe
Euere he heold is heued fo&rrot;th &punctelev; alþei heo smiten him ofte.
Þis luþere kniȝtes wenden anon &punctelev; to is treso&rrot;ie
breken is do&rrot;en and is coffres &punctelev; and duden gret robberie
heo nomen is cloþes and is ho&rrot;s &punctelev; and is treso&rrot; also
Chartres and oþur p&rrot;iue writes &punctelev; þat in is coffres weren ido
heo it bitoken sire Randolf de b&rrot;ok Brok &punctelev; þat he þarewith wende
to þe kinge into No&rrot;emandie &punctelev; and segge þat heo him sende
And þat he dude þarewith ȝwat he wolde &punctelev; and ȝif þare ani were
Aȝen is wille oþur is fraunchise &punctelev; þat he[MS. heo] sone totere
Among is treso&rrot; heo founden also &punctelev; tweie wel &slong;tronge heren
Wel filliche heo ca&slong;ten heom awei &punctelev; ase þei heo nouȝt wurth nere
Ake naþeles heo biþouȝten heom þo &punctelev; and weren somdel in fere
And seiden bitwene heom &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; guod man we wenez he were
Sire willam traci Willam Traci tolde sethþe &punctelev; of þis guode man seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Þe bischope of Eccetre in is schrifte &punctelev; ase he of him ischriue was
Þat þo þe guode man was aslawe &punctelev; and heo ovtward were
So so&rrot;e heom agros þat heo weren &punctelev; neiȝ witlese fo&rrot; fere
Fo&rrot; heom þouȝte euere ase heo eoden outward &punctelev; ne wenden heo no so bliue
Þat þe eo&rrot;þe openede onder heom &punctelev; fo&rrot;to swolewen hem aliue.
¶ Þo þis guod man imartred was &punctelev; and þe kniȝtes weren out igon
Into al þe toun of Caunterburi &punctelev; couth it was anon
Þat folc cride deolfulliche &punctelev; and to churche heo d&rrot;owe
And onovreden þat holi bodi &punctelev; and cu&slong;ten it ofte inowe
Þe Monekus monekus comen sone þerto &punctelev; and þis holi bodi toke
And leiden faire In in one bere &punctelev; and bifo&rrot;e þe Autere it biwoke
Þat face was ȝw&ydot;ȝt and cler inouȝ &punctelev; and no blod nas þarinne
bote fram þe riȝt half of is frount &punctelev; toward þe left chinne
A smal rewe þere was of blode &punctelev; þat ouer is nose d&rrot;ouȝ
Mo&rrot;e blod þar nas in al is face &punctelev; ase folk isaiȝ inouȝ
Þe woundene bledden al þe niȝt &punctelev; and men henten þareof iwis
And In in þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; of þulke blode ȝeot is
Ake he nas neuere of þe wo&rrot;se hewe &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat he bledde þere
bote in guode heowe and cler inov &punctelev; riȝt ase he liues were
And somdel le&ydot;ȝinde with þe mouþe &punctelev; he lai ase þei he slepe
Muche folk was aboute him &punctelev; þat blod fo&rrot;to kepe
And fo&rrot;to gaderi of þe blode &punctelev; þat isched was on þe grounde
And of þat eo&rrot;þe þat was bibled &punctelev; and glade weren ȝwan heo it founden
¶ Fo&rrot; þat nolde heom noman werne &punctelev; þicke awei men it d&rrot;ouȝ
And hoso miȝte enes þat bodi cusse &punctelev; he was glad inouȝ
Amo&rrot;ewe þe luþere kniȝtes &punctelev; Armeden heom eftsone
And withoute toun nome heo&rrot;e red &punctelev; ȝwat heom was to done
heo biradden fo&rrot;to nime þat holi bodi &punctelev; and with wilde ho&rrot;s tod&rrot;awe
And sethþe hangen it on a waritreo &punctelev; heo seiden þat it was lawe
Fo&rrot; he nas nouȝt wu&ydot;rþe to beon ibured &punctelev; In churche ne In in churche|ȝerd
Þe Monekus monekus þouȝten þis swiþe wel &punctelev; and weren ful so&rrot;e aferd
heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; ha&slong;teliche þerebiside
With lu&ydot;te solempnete inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo ne do&rrot;&slong;ten no leng abide
Þis holi bodi was ibured &punctelev; In þe mun&slong;tre of ihesu cri&slong;t
bifo&rrot;e seint Seint Au&slong;tines weuede &punctelev; and seint Seint
Iohanes þe bapti&slong;t
heo ne do&rrot;&slong;ten nouȝt so longue &punctelev; fo&rrot;to þat bodi iwasche were
Al ongreiþet to leggen it In in &punctelev; [heo] heiȝeden bliue fo&rrot; fere
Ase heo &slong;trepten of is cloþes &punctelev; al aboue heo founde
Clerkene cloþes ase him to bifeol &punctelev; and oþere bi þe grounde
Monekene Abite with In in ne &punctelev; ase heo founden þere
boþe Covele and &slong;tamin &punctelev; he founden next is here
So þat he was Monek monek with In in ne &punctelev; and seculer withoute
Nu&slong;te no man is p&rrot;iueite &punctelev; of þa[t] him was aboute
And next is flesche þe here was &punctelev; with knottes mani on
Þat deope in is flesche seten &punctelev; some riȝt to þe bon
Þarof he hadde schurte and b&rrot;ech &punctelev; lu&ydot;tel aise he miȝte ifele
So þat he was þareinne ibounde &punctelev; fram þe schold&rrot;e to þe hele
With lu&ydot;tel aise he miȝte sitte &punctelev; and ful onaisiliche ride
And onaisiliche ligge also &punctelev; opon eþur side.[This v. on the margin.]
Ful of wo&rrot;mes was is flesch &punctelev; to al oþur wo
In none creature ich onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; neuere ne weren iseie mo
Fo&rrot; in euereche &slong;tude of is flesche &punctelev; so þicke heo weren isete
Þat þe grete ne miȝten fo&rrot; þe smale &punctelev; comen to heo&rrot;e mete
Fa&slong;te heo schouen and cropen also &punctelev; ase ametene[fo&rrot;mice overwr.] al aboute
Ake þe smale cleoueden fa&slong;te to &punctelev; þe grete bilefden withoute
¶ he deide endleue hound&rrot;et ȝer &punctelev; and seuenti and on
After þat o&rrot;e swete louerd &punctelev; of is moder nam flesch and bon
Of þreo and fifti ȝeres elde &punctelev; himsulf he was þo
Mani a fair dai he hadde ileoued &punctelev; in care and in wo
Þe king was in no&rrot;mandie Normandie &punctelev; and herof nu&slong;te nouȝt
he made deol and so&rrot;ewe inouȝ &punctelev; þo þe tiþinge him was ib&rrot;ouȝt
In þe Ca&slong;tel of Argente&ydot;n &punctelev; he soio&rrot;nede þo
Withoute þe ȝates ne cam he nouȝt &punctelev; fourti daiȝes ne mo
Ake euere he heold him in p&rrot;iuete &punctelev; In wepinge and oþur wo
Fo&rrot; none neode þat Man man miȝte habbe &punctelev; withoute he nolde go
Ne rouȝte he noþing of þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; wel lu&ydot;te he eat also
Þe so&rrot;ewe and þe deol þat he made &punctelev; ne miȝte neuere beo ido
he sende anon to Caunterburi &punctelev; fo&rrot; þis deolful dede
And bad þe Monekus monekus pitousliche &punctelev; þat heo fo&rrot; him bede
And sende heom þat it nas &punctelev; noþing bi is rede
Ake þat þe kniȝtes wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and noþing him fo&rrot;e ne seide
And þat he sende after heom &punctelev; fo&rrot;to comen aȝe
¶ And are þe messeger were to heom icome &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren fer in þe se
to þe pope also god God &punctelev; þe king sende sone
And bad is conseil pitousliche &punctelev; ȝwat him were to done
he bad him fo&rrot; þe loue of god God &punctelev; In sw&ydot;che anguise him rede
Þat he were ischriue and asoilled &punctelev; of so luþer a dede
Þe pope hadde ful gret pite &punctelev; þat he swuch wo&rrot;d him sende
¶ And gret Io&ydot;e ioye fo&rrot; he hadde wille &punctelev; is lif fo&rrot;to amende
twei cardinales he sende him &punctelev; wise men boþe to
to schriuen him of þulke sunne &punctelev; and asoilli him also
And þe bischopus fo&rrot;to asoilli also &punctelev; þat weren in mansinge
Welle þat þe Cardinales &punctelev; welcome weren þe kinge
Þe king bad heom deolfulliche &punctelev; to schriuen him of þe dede
And bihet heom &slong;tudefa&slong;tliche &punctelev; to &slong;tonden alto heo&rrot;e rede
he swo&rrot; on þe halidom &punctelev; þat þo&rrot;uȝ him nas it nouȝt
Ne bi is wille ne bi his he&slong;te &punctelev; þat he was to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
And ȝet he seide þat fo&rrot; is fader deþe &punctelev; so so&rrot;i man he nas
Ne fo&rrot; is moderes noþemo &punctelev; Ase he fo&rrot; is deþe was
And he seide he wolde with guode heo&rrot;te &punctelev; alle þe penaunces afonge
Þat heo wolden on him legge &punctelev; ne weren heo no so &slong;tronge
Fo&rrot; he was enchaison of is deþe &punctelev; and of is anu&ydot; also
Þe kniȝtes fo&rrot;to paien him &punctelev; brouȝten him þerto
¶ Þo þe Cardinales iseiȝen þis &punctelev; þat he to repentaunce d&rrot;ouȝ
heo asoileden him and setten on him &punctelev; stronge penaunce inouȝ
In p&rrot;iuete ase riȝt was &punctelev; þat no man þarof nu&slong;te
And þis also þat ichulle novþe telle &punctelev; þat alle Men of wu&slong;ten
his p&rrot;iue penaunces some weren &punctelev; fa&slong;tinge fo&rrot;to make
[vv. 22612 om. in the other MSS.]And In in fale t&ydot;mes linne cloth and schurte of selk &punctelev; fo&rrot; is sunnes fo&rrot;sake
Into þe holie londe he scholde finde &punctelev; to hund&rrot;et kn&ydot;ȝtes to fiȝte
Al ane ȝer with þe templers &punctelev; fo&rrot; holi churche riȝte
¶ And þat he scholde þe &slong;tatus of Clarindone &punctelev; al clanliche with|d&rrot;awe
Þo&rrot;u ȝwuche &slong;tatuz þis holi man &punctelev; ib&rrot;ouȝt was of lijfdawe
And þat he clanliche ȝolde aȝein &punctelev; al þat binome was
Þe bischop&rrot;iche of Caunterburi &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathe of seint Seint
thomas Thomas
And þat he scholde is vuele wille &punctelev; also clanliche fo&rrot;ȝiue
Alle þat he hadde out of londe &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathe of him id&rrot;iue
Þe king grauntede al heo&rrot;e wille &punctelev; weopinde swiþe so&rrot;e
And seide þat it was to lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and bad on him legge mo&rrot;e
And ȝeot "al to ouwer wille here &punctelev; mi bodi ich bitake
Ȝiueth me penaunces inowe &punctelev; Inelle neuer on fo&rrot;sake
he wende out atþe Churche do&rrot;e &punctelev; asoiled fo&rrot;to beo
And seide þat he nas nouȝt wurthe &punctelev; þat men scholde him withinne iseo
And withoute churche pitousliche &punctelev; he sat adoun akne
Ake þe Cardinales nolden nouȝt &punctelev; is bodi al onwreo
And somdel aboue is cloþes &punctelev; heo asoileden him riȝt þere
Fo&rrot; deol heo weopen pitousliche &punctelev; and manie þat þare were
his sone also made one bihe&slong;te &punctelev; with wel d&rrot;eo&rrot;ie chere
Þe faderes penaunce to folfulle &punctelev; ȝif he of power nere
Oþur ȝif he felle into feble &slong;tat &punctelev; þat he ne miȝte it nouȝt fulende
Opon himself þe charge he nam &punctelev; and dude ase guod and hende
Þus was þe holi man &punctelev; ib&rrot;ouȝt to mart&ydot;rdom
Mani was þe fair miracle &punctelev; þat fo&rrot; him sone com.[Both verses are written in one line.]
[Jerusalem.]¶ Fo&rrot; In in
Ierusalemes londe men wu&slong;ten &punctelev; of is mart&ydot;rdom
With In in ne þe fur&slong;te fourteneNiȝt &punctelev; þat he þe det nam
Fo&rrot; a Monek monek in þulke londe &punctelev; In is deþe vuele lai
And is Abbod cam to him &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e is endedai[Both verses are written in one line.]
And conIurede him[MS. him þat him] þat he scholde &punctelev; after is deþe þere
to him comen and tellen him fo&rrot;e &punctelev; in ȝwuch &slong;tat he were
So þat þis Monek monek deide sone &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
to is Abbod sethþe he cam &punctelev; ase he Iconioured was
And seide þat he isaued was &punctelev; In þe Ioie ioie of heuene an heiȝ
he tolde him muche of þe Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat he þare iseiȝ
he tolde him þat þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; þat he to heuene cam
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; þolede mart&ydot;rdom
And þat is soule þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; to heuene wende anon
Fair was þat p&rrot;ocessioun &punctelev; þat aȝen him cam gon
Of Aungles and of patriarks &punctelev; and of apo&slong;tles also
Of Martirs and of confessours &punctelev; and of virgines þerto
heo nome alle þeos holi soule &punctelev; And bifo&rrot;e o&rrot;e louerd sone
brouȝten hire with Io&ydot;e ioye and blisse &punctelev; ase he sat in is throne
his croune was al of ismite &punctelev; and blodi was is heued
And is b&rrot;a&ydot;n was al isched &punctelev; þare nas nouȝt bileued
¶ Thomas
thomas Thomas quath o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; þus it fallez to þe
To þine louerdus court to come &punctelev; In swuche manere to me
Fo&rrot; þi seruise ich þe ȝ&ydot;ue &punctelev; ase muchel Ioie ioie and blis
Ase ich ȝaf seint Seint
peter Peter &punctelev; þat min Apo&slong;tel is
he sette ane Croune opon is heued &punctelev; of golde cler and guod
Sw&ydot;þe wel bicam þat b&rrot;iȝte gold &punctelev; opon þe rede blod
Mo&rrot;e Ioie ioie ne miȝte non beo &punctelev; þane In in heuene fo&rrot; him was
Fo&rrot; þe Erchebischope of caunterburi Caunterburi &punctelev; is name was seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Þe T&ydot;wesdai after Cri&slong;temasse &punctelev; þe fur&slong;te þat þere cam
Þis holi man in Engelonde &punctelev; þolede mart&ydot;rdom
And ȝwan þov iheo&rrot;&slong;t of is deþe telle &punctelev; of Men of Engelonde
Þov ileue me of þis tale &punctelev; and þe soþe onder&slong;tonde
Þe Abbod sone amo&rrot;ewe &punctelev; ne furȝat nouȝt seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Ake þe patria[r]cke of Ierusalem &punctelev; he tolde al hov it was
So þat fo&rrot;þere in þe ȝere &punctelev; it was wel onder&slong;tonde
Þo pilegrimes þudere comen &punctelev; out of Engelonde
In ȝwat manere he was aslawe &punctelev; and ȝwuch t&ydot;me he was ded
Þe pilegrimes tolden al þe soþe &punctelev; ase þe Monek monek hadde er iseid
Þus was ikud In in
Ierusalem &punctelev; þe deth of seint Seint
thomas Thomas
With In in ne þe fur&slong;te fourtene n&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; þat he imartred was.
[Guerra regum.]¶ þe fifte ȝer ich onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; after is mart&ydot;rdom
bitwene k&ydot;ng henri Henri and is sone &punctelev; gret contek þare bicom
Þe sone bicam p&rrot;out anon &punctelev; fo&rrot; is k&ydot;nedom
And of is fader tolde lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and werre ope him nam
Þe me&slong;te del was with is sone &punctelev; of al Engelonde
And þe k&ydot;ng of Fraunce also &punctelev; and þe king of scotlonde Scotlonde
So þat þis seli oldeman &punctelev; In so&rrot;ewe was Inovȝ
Al he it wu&slong;te þe luþere dede &punctelev; þat man seint Seint
thomas Thomas aslouȝ
he wende him out of No&rrot;mundie &punctelev; toward Engelonde
Are he come to Caunterbiri &punctelev; he nolde nouȝwere at&slong;tonde
And þo he cam fer w[i]thoute þe toun &punctelev; he gan to liȝte adoun
Al afote and barefot &punctelev; he wende into þe toun
In is Curtel one and ongurd &punctelev; ase al þat folk isaiȝ
Riȝt so he wende to þe &slong;tude &punctelev; þere seint Seint
thomas Thomas lai
At is toumbe he feol adoun akneo &punctelev; wepinde wel so&rrot;e
he heold op is hondene deolfolliche &punctelev; and cride him milce and o&rrot;e
¶ Wepinde in is o&rrot;esones &punctelev; al fa&slong;tinde he lai
At þis holi mannes toumbe &punctelev; a n&ydot;ȝt and al a dai
Of euerech Monek monek of þe hous &punctelev; he tok is discipline
With a smart ȝeo&rrot;de and ȝeot him þouȝte &punctelev; þere was to lu&ydot;te pine
he bad heom alle deolfulliche &punctelev; bidden fo&rrot; him one
And swo&rrot; he wolde legge adoun &punctelev; þe luþere lawene echone
¶ So þat he let singe ane masse &punctelev; are he þannes wende
In þe honour of seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; þat he is grace him sende
Þe ȝw&ydot;le men þe masse songe &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
Þe k&ydot;ng of Scotlond was inome &punctelev; þat me&slong;t is fo was
And manie oþere also with him &punctelev; þat weren is &slong;tron[ge] fon
So þat heo þat weren vnnome &punctelev; to him nadden power non
his folk dude þe bataille &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le þe masse ila&slong;te[MS. &slong;ta&slong;te]
Þarto heo hadden lu&ydot;te help &punctelev; and weren wel so&rrot;e aga&slong;te
Ake o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; seint Seint
thomas Thomas loue &punctelev; his grace wel sone him ca&slong;te
So þat heo&rrot;e fon weren some[m MS. sone] inome &punctelev; and some flouwen wel fa&slong;te
So þat þis seli olde king &punctelev; þat al bineþe er was
Al aboue was sone ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ bone of seint Seint
thomas Thomas
And is sone was al bineþe &punctelev; and so he biȝat wel lu&ydot;te
Fo&rrot;to weo&rrot;ri aȝein is fader &punctelev; fo&rrot; is so&rrot;i p&rrot;u&ydot;te
bi him men mowen nime ensaumple &punctelev; to beon to ha&slong;tiue
to ȝiuen heo&rrot;e sones op heo&rrot;e lond &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le heo hemsulue beoth aliue
Þe kingus sone þareafterward &punctelev; prouede vuele inovȝ
And wel longe bifo&rrot;e þe fadere &punctelev; toward þe deþe he d&rrot;ouȝ
And furpinede in þe menisone &punctelev; þat is lif him þouȝte long
he deide sethþe deolfolliche &punctelev; in gret pine and &slong;trong
his b&rrot;oþer also sire Geffrei &punctelev; þat Erl of b&rrot;uta&ydot;ne Brutayne was
Deide also in þe menison &punctelev; In þulke sulue cas
So þat after is fader deþe &punctelev; þare ne lefde eir non
bote heo&rrot;e ȝongue b&rrot;oþer king Richard &punctelev; and sethþe þe king Iohan
Ake sire Geffreies child &punctelev; with riȝte lawe of londe
Þe heritage scholde habbe ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; ase ich me onder&slong;tonde.
[Mo&rrot;s Militum.]¶ Þeos luþere kniȝtes alle foure &punctelev; þat slowen seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Deiden in &slong;tronge deþe inouȝ &punctelev; ase wel riȝt it[MS. it it] was
heo weren echone repentaunt &punctelev; ne miȝten none men mo&rrot;e
euere heo criden on seint Seint
thomas Thomas &punctelev; to ȝiuen heom milce and o&rrot;e
Sone afterward þat he was aslawe &punctelev; al heo&rrot;e guod hu&ydot; lete
And wenden to þe holi lond &punctelev; heo&rrot;e sunnes fo&rrot;to bete
Ake sire Willame traci Willame Traci ne wende nouȝt &punctelev; fo&rrot;th with þe oþere þreo
he hopede here In in
Engelonde &punctelev; Inouȝ repentaunt to beo
[These two verses are tr. in the MS.]Þareafterward he bicam &punctelev; in grete meseise and &slong;trong
his flesch bigan to b&rrot;eken out &punctelev; and rotede an fovle &slong;tonk
So longue þat he &slong;tonk so foule &punctelev; þat deul it was to se
Þat onneþe ani man miȝte &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;tunche neiȝ him beo
his flesch rotede on him also &punctelev; and al dai ful awei
Þat is bones weren al bare &punctelev; þo ne likede him no plei
Wit is hondene he tod&rrot;ouȝ also &punctelev; his flesch atþe la&slong;te
pece and oþur al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; awei fram him he ca&slong;te
hondene and Armes armes he tod&rrot;ovȝ &punctelev; me&slong;t of echon
Þat þere nas no flesch bileued &punctelev; bote senue and bare bon
Manie men it þouȝten wel &punctelev; þat bi is wille it were
Al fo&rrot;to biete[MS. biete] is sunnes here &punctelev; þat is soule in helle nere
Wrechchedo&rrot;e go&slong;t ne miȝte non beo &punctelev; þane þis p&rrot;isun was
And euere he cride deolfulliche &punctelev; merci seint Seint
thomas Thomas
Atþe la&slong;te he let is lijf &punctelev; In wel &slong;tronge pine
And ȝif o&rrot;e louerdes wille was &punctelev; he cam to guode fine
Þis kniȝtes aftur heo&rrot;e luþere dedene[al. dede] &punctelev; deiden sone echon
So þat with In in ne þe þridde ȝere &punctelev; aliue ne lefde þer non
Fo&rrot; þe sauter seith þat swuche men &punctelev; þat of tricherie beoth
Ne schullen nouȝt halue heo&rrot;e dawes libbe &punctelev; ase ȝe alda[i] iseoth
Þei heo beon sw&ydot;þe repentaunt &punctelev; ase þis kniȝtes weren ich wene
Ȝu&ydot;t ne libbeth heo nouȝt half heo&rrot;e lif &punctelev; ant þat was bi heom isene.
¶ Seint thomas Thomas þis holi man &punctelev; onder eo&rrot;þe he la&ydot;
Are þat he Ischrined were &punctelev; wel mani a long da&ydot;
he lai þere nine[al. inne] and fourti ȝer &punctelev; and half a ȝer þerto
And aboute ane Eiȝte dawes &punctelev; are he were of eo&rrot;þe ido
god wolde abide ane guode t&ydot;me &punctelev; to don so noble þing
Þat þare weren boþe guode &punctelev; Erchebischop and king
Fo&rrot; þe king Iohan þat longue was &punctelev; euere of luþere rede
lu&ydot;te þouȝte bi is daie &punctelev; to don so guode dede
¶ Ake þe king henri Henri is ȝonge sone &punctelev; nolde nouȝt longe afine
After þat he was king imad &punctelev; are seint Seint
thomas Thomas were in schrine
he nas nouȝt þrettene ȝeres old &punctelev; þo he dude þis noble þing
And it was in þe feo&rrot;þe ȝere &punctelev; þat he was imad ȝong king
Þe guode Erchebischop &slong;teuene &punctelev; radde fa&slong;te þerto
So þat bi ho&rrot;e boþe redes &punctelev; þis dede was ido
Þe pope hono&rrot;ie þat was þo &punctelev; hidere he gan sende
Ane legat fram Rome þat het
pandulf Pandulf &punctelev; to b&rrot;inge þis dede to ende
Þe pope ȝaf alle pardon &punctelev; þat þudere wolden gon
Þat men nu&slong;ten in Engelonde &punctelev; suu&ydot;ch pardon non
Þarefo&rrot;e fo&rrot;to honouri þis holi man &punctelev; þere cam folk inovȝ
Of bischopes and of Abbodes abbodes &punctelev; mani on þudere d&rrot;ouȝ
Of p&rrot;io&rrot;es and of persones &punctelev; and manie oþur clerkes also
Of Eo&rrot;les and of barones &punctelev; and manie kniȝtes heom to
Of seriaunz and of squiers &punctelev; and oþere housebondes inowe
And þe simple men of þe londe &punctelev; so þicke þudere d&rrot;owe
Þat al þe contreie þareaboute &punctelev; þe tounes wide and longe[MS. londe]
Vnneþe miȝten al þat folk &punctelev; þat þudere cam afonge
¶ So þat þis heiȝe men &punctelev; þat scholden þis dede do
Weren in care hov heo miȝten &punctelev; fo&rrot; p&rrot;ece comen þerto
So þat Erchebischop &slong;teuene &punctelev; of ȝwam ich er ov seide
And þe bischop Richard of Salesburi &punctelev; þarof heom nomen to rede
And p&rrot;io&rrot; water of þe house &punctelev; and þe couent also
Wenden heom in p&rrot;iuete &punctelev; þis dede fo&rrot;to do
bi niȝte þo men weren aslepe &punctelev; and lu&ydot;te þaron þouȝte
heo nomes[r. nomen] op þe holi bones &punctelev; and in one che&slong;te b&rrot;ouȝte
And setten heom in a p&rrot;iue &slong;tude &punctelev; fo&rrot;to þe time was icome
þat[MS. hit] was icrid into al þat lond &punctelev; þat heo scholden beo up inome
It was in þe monþe of Iulie &punctelev; euene þene seuenthe dai
bi a tiwesdai Tiwesdai it was þo &punctelev; ase al þat folk isaiȝ
Þo þe dai was icome &punctelev; to þe mun&slong;tre heo wenden anon
K&ydot;ng henri Henri þat ȝonge child &punctelev; an þe heiȝe men echon
Aboute onderne of þe daie &punctelev; to þis holi bones heo come
PAndulf wende fur&slong;t þerto &punctelev; þat legat was of rome Rome
And þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; and þe Erchebischop of reins also
Þat fo&rrot; þulke þinge cam &punctelev; fram biȝeonde se þerto
And sire hubert de bo&rrot;uȝ Hubert de Bo&rrot;uȝ &punctelev; þat þo was heiȝ Iu&slong;tise
Þeos foure grete louerdes &punctelev; þat noble men weren and wise
On heo&rrot;e schold&rrot;es hu&ydot; nomen up &punctelev; þis holi bodi anon
¶ Bischopus and Abbodes abbodes also &punctelev; it beren ful mani on
to þe heiȝe weuede of þe trinite &punctelev; þe holie bones heo bere
And leiden þe Che&slong;te al þarewith &punctelev; In a noble schrine þere
Þis king henri Henri was so ȝong &punctelev; þat he ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝt
With þe oþere bere þat holi bodi &punctelev; la&slong;te men him hurten ouȝt
It was bi a tiwesdai Tiwesdai &punctelev; þat heo þe bones op nome
Alle is chaunces þat he hadde &punctelev; bi tiwesdawes Tiwesdawes him come
In a tiwesdai Tiwesdai he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and of is moder wombe he cam
And also ase men b&rrot;inguth ane þeof &punctelev; fo&rrot;to afonge is dom
bifo&rrot;e þe k&ydot;nge at No&rrot;ehaumptone &punctelev; opon a tiwesdaiȝ
